Address.name: Address
Address.description: Represents a mailing, billing, or home address.

AddressType.description: Picklist of address types. The values are: Mailing Shipping Billing Home

Description.description: A brief description of the address.

GeocodeAccuracy.description: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. A geocoding service typically provides this value based on the address’s latitude and longitude coordinates.

LastReferencedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user referenced this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user viewed this record.

Latitude.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places.

LocationType.description: Picklist of location types. The available values are: Warehouse (default) Site Van Plant

Longitude.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places.

Name.description: Name of the address.

ParentId.description: A lookup field to the parent location.

AppExtension.name: AppExtension
AppExtension.description: Represents a connection between the Field Service mobile app and another app, typically for passing record data to the Salesforce mobile app or other apps.

AppExtensionLabel.description: The label in the UI for the app extension.

AppExtensionName.description: The API name of the app extension.

FieldServiceMobileSettingsId.description: The ID of a set of field service mobile settings.

InstallationUrl.description: The URL that takes the user to the app install location, such as the App Store or Google Play.

LaunchValue.description: A value directing the Field Service app to the appropriate app extension. The Launch Value can be a static URL or a dynamic value that you can represent with certain tokens. These tokens pass field information from the record that the user is currently viewing. The basic format for these tokens is based on the field names; for example: {!$Name}.

ScopedToObjectTypes.description: Indicates the types of records from which the app extension can be activated. Scoping an app extension to an object lets users activate the app extension from records of the specified type. For example, to scope to both work orders and service appointments you would use the value WorkOrder,ServiceAppointment.

Type.description: A picklist of types of app extensions: iOS, Android, Flow, and Lightning Apps

ApptBundleAggrDurDnscale.name: ApptBundleAggrDurDnscale
ApptBundleAggrDurDnscale.description: Sums the duration of the bundle members, reduced by a predefined percentage.

BundleAggregationPolicyId.description: The ID of the parent appointment bundle aggregation policy.

FromBundleMemberNumber.description: The number of the first bundle member to which the downscale is applied.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

MaxReduction.description: The maximum reduction that can be applied to a bundle member.

Name.description: The name of the appointment bundle aggregation downscale policy.

ToBundleMemberNumber.description: The number of the last bundle member to which the downscale is applied.

ApptBundleAggrPolicy.name: ApptBundleAggrPolicy
ApptBundleAggrPolicy.description: Policy that defines how the property values of the bundle members are aggregated and assigned to the bundle.

AggregationAction.description: The aggregation action to be performed.

AggregationFieldType.description: The target field type in the bundle to which the aggregation is directed.

AggregationOrder.description: The order the aggregation is triggered.

BundleFieldName.description: Name of the target field in the bundle where the value is taken from the bundle member.

BundleMemberAddiFieldName.description: Name of an additional source field that is connected to the initial source field in the bundle member from which the value is taken.

BundleMemberFieldName.description: Name of the source field in the bundle member from which the value is taken.

BundlePolicyId.description: ID of the parent bundle policy.

ConstantValue.description: The constant value that is used in the aggregation.

DateValue.description: Represents how the date value will be determined.

DoesAllowDuplicateStrings.description: Indicates if you want to allow the same string to appear more than once when using the 'Sum based on Bundle Members' action type.

DownscaleSortDirection.description: Applies only if the Set Downscaled Duration action is set. The downscaling sorting direction of the bundle member service appointments, according to their duration.

FilterCriteriaId.description: The active recordset filter criteria used for aggregating the bundle members.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

MaxBundleDuration.description: The maximum bundle duration that can be accumulated from the bundle members (after downscaling).

Name.description: The name of the appointment bundle aggregation policy.

ShouldUpdateOnCreationOnly.description: Indicates if you want to update the field in the bundle only when it is created.

ApptBundleConfig.name: ApptBundleConfig
ApptBundleConfig.description: Represents the general parameters that define the behavior of the bundle.

AddToBundleStatuses.description: The statuses of service appointment that are allowed to be bundled.

BundleStatusesToPropagate.description: The bundle statuses that when updated are inherited by the bundle members.

CriteriaForAutoUnbundlingId.description: The criteria that causes a bundle service appointment to be unbundled.

DoesAddTravelTime.description: If the bundle members aren’t in the same location, add travel time between them to the bundle’s duration according to their sort order. The default value is false.

DoesDeleteEmptyBundles.description: If the bundle has no remaining bundle members, the bundle is deleted.

EmptyBundleStatus.description: The status from the Canceled category that a bundle service appointment changes to if it has no remaining bundle members, but still appears in the appointment list.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

MemberStatusesNotToPropagate.description: The bundle member statuses that aren’t overridden when the bundle's status is updated.

Name.description: The name of the Appointment Bundle Config.

OwnerId.description: ID of the owner of this object.

RemoveFromBundleStatuses.description: The statuses of service appointments that are allowed to be removed from a bundle.

StatusOnRemovalFromBundle.description: The status that a service appointment is given when it’s removed from a bundle.

StatusesNotToUpdateOnUnbundle.description: The statuses that aren’t updated when a bundle is unbundled.

ApptBundlePolicy.name: ApptBundlePolicy
ApptBundlePolicy.description: Policy that defines how the bundling of service appointments should be handled.

BundleEndTimeFieldName.description: If IsTimeCalcByBundleDurationField is true, this field represents the name of the field used for entering the end time of the bundle.

BundleStartTimeFieldName.description: If IsTimeCalcByBundleDurationField is true, this field represents the name of the field used for entering the start time of the bundle.

CanAllowSchleDepndInBundle.description: This field is reserved for future use.

ConstantTimeValue.description: If IsTimeCalcByBundleDurationField is true, this field represents the total time of the bundle as a preset constant value.

FilterCriteriaId.description: The active recordset filter criteria used for the bundle members. Only service appointments that meet the criteria can be bundled.

IsAutomaticBundling.description: Indicates if the policy is relevant for automatic bundling.

IsManualBundling.description: Indicates if the policy is relevant for manual bundling.

IsTimeCalcByBundleDurationFld.description: Indicates if the bundle’s duration is validated. If true, the bundle’s start time is subtracted from the bundle’s end time. If the result is a negative value, it uses ConstantTimeValue as the bundle’s duration.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

LimitAmountOfBundleMembers.description: The maximum number of bundle members that can be included in a bundle.

LimitDurationOfBundle.description: The maximum duration of a bundle.

Name.description: Name of the bundle policy.

OwnerId.description: ID of the owner of this object.

Priority.description: The priority level that this bundle policy should be given when the bundle policies are analyzed using the automatic mode.

ApptBundlePolicySvcTerr.name: ApptBundlePolicySvcTerr
ApptBundlePolicySvcTerr.description: Represents a link between the BundlePolicy and the ServiceTerritory.

BundlePolicyId.description: The ID of the parent bundle policy.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

Name.description: The name of the appointment bundle service territory.

ServiceTerritoryId.description: The ID of the service territory.

ApptBundlePropagatePolicy.name: ApptBundlePropagatePolicy
ApptBundlePropagatePolicy.description: Policy that defines which property values are inherited from the bundle to the bundle members or are assigned as constant values in the bundle members.

AdditionalConstantValue.description: The additional constant value that is connected to the initial constant value to be added to the bundle members.

BundleFieldName.description: Name of the source field in the bundle from which the value is taken.

BundleMemberFieldName.description: Name of the target field in the bundle member where the value is inherited from the bundle.

BundlePolicyId.description: ID of the parent bundle policy.

ConstantValue.description: The constant value to be added to the bundle members.

DateValue.description: Represents how the date value is determined.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

Name.description: The name of the appointment bundle propagation policy.

ShouldAddConstantValue.description: Indicates if you want to enable adding a constant value to the bundle members.

ShouldUpdateOnAdd.description: Indicates if you want to enable updating the fields of the bundle members when they are added to the bundle.

ShouldUpdateOnRemove.description: Indicates if you want to enable updating the fields of the bundle members when they are removed from the bundle.

ShouldUpdateOnUnbundle.description: Indicates if you want to enable updating the fields of the bundle members when performing the Unbundle action.

ApptBundleRestrictPolicy.name: ApptBundleRestrictPolicy
ApptBundleRestrictPolicy.description: Policy that defines the restrictions that are considered while forming a bundle.

BundlePolicyId.description: ID of the parent bundle policy.

DoesAllowEmpty.description: Allows a bundle member service appointment with an empty Restriction Field Name to be bundled.

DoesRestrictAutomaticMode.description: Indicates if you want to apply this restriction when using the automatic mode.

DoesRestrictManualMode.description: Indicates if you want to apply this restriction when using the manual mode.

IsRestrictByDateOnly.description: Indicates if you want the bundle to be restricted according to the calendar date only, ignoring the time of day.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

Name.description: The name of the appointment bundle restriction policy.

RestrictionFieldName.description: Name of the field in the service appointment used for applying the restriction.

ApptBundleSortPolicy.name: ApptBundleSortPolicy
ApptBundleSortPolicy.description: Policy that defines the properties by which the bundle members are sorted within the bundle. Can also be used in the automatic mode for determining the order of the automatic selection of bundle members.

BundlePolicyId.description: The ID of the parent bundle policy.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

Name.description: Name of the appointment bundle sort policy.

SortDirection.description: The order of the appointments in a bundle

SortFieldName.description: Name of the field in the service appointment used for sorting the bundle members.

SortOrder.description: The order of fields used for sorting the bundle members.

SortType.description: The applied sort type for arranging the bundle. Sort for Automatic Bundling defines the order that automated bundling uses to examine the candidate service appointments to be bundled. Sort Within a Bundle defines the order of bundle members. It’s also used when you unbundle to define the order that the service appointments are scheduled on the Gantt.

Asset.name: Asset
Asset.description: Represents an item of commercial value, such as a product sold by your company or a competitor, that a customer has purchased.

AccountId.description: (Required) ID of the Account associated with this asset. Must be a valid account ID. Required if ContactId isn’t specified.

Address.description: Represents the physical address or geolocation of the asset.

AssetLevel.description: The asset’s position in an asset hierarchy. If the asset has no parent or child assets, its level is 1. Assets that belong to a hierarchy have a level of 1 for the root asset, 2 for the child assets of the root asset, 3 for their children, and so forth. On assets created before the introduction of this field, the asset level defaults to –1. After the asset record is updated, the asset level is calculated and automatically updated.

AssetProvidedById.description: The account that provided the asset, typically a manufacturer.

AssetServicedById.description: The account in charge of servicing the asset.

AssetTypeId.description: The asset type associated with the asset.

Availability.description: The percentage of expected uptime where the asset was available for use.

AveragetimetoRepair.description: Represents the number of hours it typically takes to repair an asset after a failure.

AveragetimeBetweenFailure.description: Represents the number of hours that typically elapses before the asset is likely to fail again.

AverageUptimePerDay.description: The average number of hours per day the asset is expected to be available for use.

City.description: The city detail for the address.

ConsequenceOfFailure.description: The business impact associated with the asset’s failure. Using this field, you can address the asset’s health and take action using Flows. To enable this field, use Object Manager to update the field availability. Make sure that the field is visible for field-level security and for page layout. To learn more, see What Determines Field Access. The picklist values aren’t predefined in orgs created before Winter ’22 that aren’t Field Service enabled. This field is available in API version 53.0 and later.

ContactId.description: Required if AccountId isn’t specified. ID of the Contact associated with this asset. Must be a valid contact ID that has an account parent (but doesn’t need to match the asset’s AccountId).

Country.description: The country detail for the address.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the invoice. The default value is USD.

CurrentAmount.description: Reserved for future use. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Subscription Management is enabled.

CurrentLifecycleEndDate.description: Represents the end of the period shown as current. System-populated field inherited from the end date of the current asset state period. If that field is empty, as with an evergreen subscription, the Current Lifecycle End Date field is also empty. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Subscription Management is enabled.

CurrentMrr.description: The asset’s monthly recurring revenue during the current asset state period. System-populated field inherited from the monthly recurring revenue on the current asset state period. If no asset state period is current, the value is 0. Label is Current Monthly Recurring Revenue. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Subscription Management is enabled.

CurrentQuantity.description: The asset’s quantity during the current asset state period. System-populated field inherited from the quantity on the current asset state period. If no asset state period is current, the value is 0. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Subscription Management is enabled.

Description.description: Description of the asset.

DigitalAssetStatus.description: Status of digital tracking of the asset. The default picklist includes the following values: On Off Warning Error

ExternalIdentifier.description: The ID of the matching record in an external system. This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

GeocodeAccuracy.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the address.

HasLifecycleManagement.description: True if this asset is a lifecycle-managed asset, otherwise false. You can’t switch an asset to a lifecycle-managed asset or the reverse. This field is system populated.

InstallDate.description: Date when the asset was installed.

IsCompetitorProduct.description: Indicates whether this Asset represents a product sold by a competitor (true) or not (false). The default value is false. Its UI label is Competitor Asset.

IsInternal.description: Indicates that the asset is produced or used internally (true) or not (false). The default value is false. Its UI label is Internal Asset.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date and time that the asset was last modified. Its UI label is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date and time that the asset was last viewed.

Latitude.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address.

LifecycleEndDate.description: Represents the end of the asset’s lifecycle. System-populated field inherited from the end date of the final asset state period. If that field is empty, as with an evergreen subscription, the lifecycle has no end date. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Subscription Management is enabled.

LifecycleStartDate.description: Represents the beginning of the asset’s lifecycle. System-populated field inherited from the start date of the earliest asset state period. This field can’t be edited. When a new asset action affects the start date of an asset state period, the period is deleted and a new one is generated. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Subscription Management is enabled.

LocationId.description: The asset’s location. Typically, this location is the place where the asset is stored, such as a warehouse or van.

Longitude.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address.

ManufactureDate.description: The date when the asset was manufactured. This field is available from API version 49.0 and later.

Name.description: (Required) Name of the asset. Label is Asset Name.

OwnerId.description: The asset’s owner. By default, the asset owner is the user who created the asset record. Its UI label is Asset Owner.

ParentId.description: The asset’s parent asset. Its UI label is Parent Asset.

PostalCode.description: The postal code for the address.

PricingSource.description: Pricing source to use when amending or renewing an asset.

Product2Id.description: (Optional) ID of the Product2 associated with this asset. Must be a valid Product2 ID. Its UI label is Product.

ProductCode.description: The product code of the related product.

ProductDescription.description: The product description of the related product.

ProductFamily.description: The product family of the related product.

PurchaseDate.description: Date on which this asset was purchased.

Quantity.description: Quantity purchased or installed. The Quantity field value isn’t set by Customer Asset Lifecycle Management. Instead, you can populate the field as you need.

QuantityIncreasePricingType.description: Specify which pricing type to use when the quantity of this asset is increased. Its UI label is Pricing Type for Quantity Increase. This field is available in API version 56.0 and later. This field is available when Subscription Management is enabled.

RecordTypeId.description: The unique identifier for the asset.

Reliability.description: The percentage of expected uptime where the asset wasn’t subject to unplanned downtime.

RenewalPricingType.description: The price used when renewing a subscription. Its UI label is Pricing Type for Renewal. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later. This field is available when Subscription Management is enabled.

RenewalTerm.description: With Renewal Term Unit, defines the default subscription term for renewal quotes. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later. This field is available when Subscription Management is enabled.

RenewalTermUnit.description: The unit of time for a subscription term. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later. This field is available when Subscription Management is enabled.

RootAssetId.description: (Read only) The top-level asset in an asset hierarchy. Depending on where an asset lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent. Its UI label is Root Asset.

SalesStoreId.description: ID of the RetailStore or WebStore associated with this Asset.

State.description: The state detail for the address.

Status.description: Customizable picklist of values. The default picklist includes the following values: Purchased Shipped Installed Registered Obsolete

StatusReason.description: The explanation of the device status. This field is available from API version 49.0 and later.

StockKeepingUnit.description: The SKU assigned to the related product.

Street.description: The street detail for the address.

SumDowntime.description: Accumulated downtime (planned and unplanned), determined as follows: When only UptimeRecordStart is set, the sum of all downtime from UptimeRecordStart When UptimeRecordStart and UptimeRecordEnd are set, the sum of all downtime from UptimeRecordStart to UptimeRecordEnd Otherwise, downtime isn’t accumulated.

SumUnplannedDowntime.description: Accumulated unplanned downtime, determined as follows: When only UptimeRecordStart is set, the sum of all unplanned downtime from UptimeRecordStart When UptimeRecordStart and UptimeRecordEnd are set, the sum of all unplanned downtime from UptimeRecordStart to UptimeRecordEnd Otherwise, unplanned downtime isn’t accumulated.

TotalLifecycleAmount.description: The total amount of revenue for the asset, including revenue from each stage in the asset lifecycle. This field is available when CPQ Plus, Salesforce Billing, or Subscription Management is enabled.

UptimeRecordEnd.description: The date until which SumDowntime and SumUnplannedDowntime are accumulated.

UptimeRecordStart.description: The date from which SumDowntime and SumUnplannedDowntime are accumulated.

UsageEndDate.description: Date when usage for this asset ends or expires.

Uuid.description: The unique ID for the asset. This field is available in API version 49.0 and later.

AssetAccountParticipant.name: AssetAccountParticipant
AssetAccountParticipant.description: Represents a junction between the Asset and Account objects describing the association between a participating account and an asset.

AccountId.description: The stakeholder account associated with the asset.

AssetId.description: The asset associated with the account.

EffectiveEndDate.description: The date when the association between the stakeholder and the vehicle ended.

EffectiveStartDate.description: The date when the association between the stakeholder and the vehicle was initiated.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the association between the stakeholder and the vehicle is active (true) or not (false).

LastReferencedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user referenced this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user viewed this record.

Name.description: The name of the asset account participant.

RecordTypeId.description: The record type associated with the asset account participant.

StakeholderRole.description: Specifies the role of the associated account.

UsageType.description: Specifies the usage type of the asset account participant.

VehicleId.description: The vehicle that's marked as an asset.

AssetAttribute.name: AssetAttribute
AssetAttribute.description: Stores asset attributes to track and analyze asset conditions to improve their uptime.

AttributeDefinitionId.description: The ID of the attribute definition for this asset attribute.

AttributeName.description: The name given to the asset attribute in the UI by the user.

AttributePicklistValueId.description: The ID of the attribute picklist value if the attribute is a picklist type.

AttributeValue.description: Stores the value of an asset attribute, for example 5-TB storage .

ExternalId.description: An auto-generated ID of the attribute record saved in an external system (for example an HBase database). This field is reserved and used for internal purpose.

AssetContactParticipant.name: AssetContactParticipant
AssetContactParticipant.description: Represents a junction between the Asset and Contact objects describing the association between a participating contact and an asset.

AssetId.description: The asset associated with the contact.

ContactId.description: The contact associated with the asset.

EffectiveEndDate.description: The date when the association between the stakeholder and the vehicle ended.

EffectiveStartDate.description: The date when the association between the stakeholder and the vehicle was initiated.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the association between the stakeholder and the vehicle is active (true) or not (false).

LastReferencedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user referenced this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user viewed this record.

Name.description: The name of the asset contact participant.

StakeholderRole.description: Specifies the role of the associated contact.

UsageType.description: Specifies the usage type of the asset contact participant.

VehicleId.description: The vehicle that's marked as an asset.

AssetDowntimePeriod.name: AssetDowntimePeriod
AssetDowntimePeriod.description: Represents a period during which an asset is not able to perform as expected. Downtime periods include planned activities, such as maintenance, and unplanned events, such as mechanical breakdown.

AssetDowntimePeriodNumber.description: The unique number of this asset downtime period record.

AssetId.description: The ID of the asset this asset downtime period record is for.

Description.description: The description of this asset downtime period.

DowntimeType.description: The type of this asset downtime period. Possible values are: Planned Unplanned

EndTime.description: The time this asset downtime period ended.

IsExcluded.description: Whether this asset downtime period is excluded from the calculation of accumulated downtime and accumulated unplanned downtime, and therefore not included in availability and reliability calculations.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

StartTime.description: The time this asset downtime period started.

AssetRelationship.name: AssetRelationship
AssetRelationship.description: Represents a non-hierarchical relationship between assets due to an asset modification; for example, a replacement, upgrade, or other circumstance. In Subscription Management and Revenue Lifecycle Management, this object represents an asset or assets grouped in a bundle or set.

AssetId.description: The unique identifier of the new asset, which is the asset that is taking the place of the existing asset.

AssetRelationshipNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the asset relationship.

AssetRole.description: Describes the position of the main asset relative to the other assets in the relationship.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the asset. The default value is USD.

FromDate.description: The date when the new asset was installed.

GroupingKey.description: Read-only field used to indicate the bundle that an asset belongs to. For example, if two assets have the same GroupingKey value, then it means that the assets are bundled together.

ProductRelationshipTypeId.description: The unique identifier of the record that describes the relationship between the main and associated assets.

ProductRelatedComponent.description: The product related component that’s associated with the asset relationship.

RelatedAssetId.description: The existing asset that is being modified.

RelatedAssetPricing.description: Specifies whether the price of the related asset is included in the bundle price. Valid values are: IncludedInBundlePrice NotIncludedInBundlePrice

RelatedAssetQtyScaleMethod.description: Specifies how the quantity of the related asset changes relative to the quantity of the parent asset. Valid values are: Constant Proportional

RelatedAssetRole.description: Describes the position of the associated asset relative to other assets in the relationship.

RelationshipType.description: The type of relationship between the existing asset and the new asset. This field comes with three values—Replacement, Upgrade, and Crossgrade—, but you can create more values in Setup.

ToDate.description: The date when the modified asset is uninstalled.

AssetWarranty.name: AssetWarranty
AssetWarranty.description: Defines the warranty terms applicable to an asset along with any exclusions and extensions.

AssetId.description: The ID of the asset this warranty term applies to.

AssetWarrantyNumber.description: The identifier of the asset warranty record.

EndDate.description: The date on which this warranty term expires.

ExchangeType.description: The type of exchange offered by this warranty term.

ExpensesCoveredEndDate.description: The date on which cover for expenses ends.

IsTransferable.description: Defines whether the warranty term can be transferred to a new owner.

LaborCoveredEndDate.description: The date on which cover for labor ends.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the asset warranty term was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the asset warranty term was last viewed.

PartsCoveredEndDate.description: The date on which cover for parts ends.

Pricebook2Id.description: The ID of the price book item associated with this asset warranty term.

StartDate.description: The date on which cover under this warranty term starts.

WarrantyTermId.description: The ID of the warranty term this asset warranty term extends.

AssignedResource.name: AssignedResource
AssignedResource.description: Represents a service resource who is assigned to a service appointment in Field Service and Lightning Scheduler. Assigned resources appear in the Assigned Resources related list on service appointments.

ActualTravelTime.description: The number of minutes that the service resource needs to travel to the assigned service appointment. You can enter a value with up to two decimal places.

ApptAssistantInfoUrl.description: The URL that contains the status of the mobile worker approaching the service appointment, the Community URL, and the expiry of the URL. Available in version 51.0 and later.

AssignedResourceNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the resource assignment.

EstimatedTravelTime.description: The estimated number of minutes needed for the service resource to travel to the service appointment they’re assigned to. You can enter a value with up to two decimal places.

LocationStatus.description: The status of the mobile worker approaching the service appointment. When the location status changes to one of these values, a status update containing ApptAssistantInfoUrl is sent to the customer. Available in version 51.0 and later.

IsPrimaryResource.description: Indicates whether the service resource is a primary resource or not. The default value is false. Available in API version 47.0 and later.

ServiceAppointmentId.description: The service appointment that the resource is assigned to.

ServiceCrewId.description: The service crew that the resource is assigned to. Note Since service resources can represent crews or individuals, appointments are typically assigned to crews in the following way: Create a service resource of the Crew type that represent the crew. Create an assigned resource on the service appointment and select the crew resource in the ServiceResourceId field. As an alternative, you can assign appointments to crew members separately. This lets you track each member’s travel time and see a list of the crew members in the Assigned Resources related list. To take this approach, create an assigned resource for each crew member. List the crew member in the ServiceResourceId field and the crew they belong to in the ServiceCrewId field.

ServiceResourceId.description: The resource who is assigned to the service appointment.

Transaction.description: The last transaction ID of the scheduling and optimization request that updated this object. The transaction ID is automatically generated and populated by the Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization engine. Available in API version 63.0 and later.

AssociatedLocation.name: AssociatedLocation
AssociatedLocation.description: Represents a link between an account and a location in Field Service. You can associate multiple accounts with one location. For example, a shopping center location may have multiple customer accounts.

ActiveFrom.description: Date and time the associated location is active.

ActiveTo.description: Date and time the associated location stops being active.

AssociatedLocationNumber.description: Auto-generated number identifying the associated location.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date the associated location was last modified.

LastViewedDate.description: The date the associated location was last viewed.

LocationId.description: The location associated with the address.

ParentRecordId.description: The account associated with the location.

Type.description: Picklist of address types. The values are: Bill To Ship To

AttributeDefinition.name: AttributeDefinition
AttributeDefinition.description: Represents a product, asset, or object attribute, for example, a hardward specification or software detail.

DataType.description: The data type of the attribute definition.

DefaultValue.description: The default value for this attribute.

Description.description: Description of this attribute.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the attribute definition record.

IsActive.description: Indicates that the attribute definition is active. Active attributes definitions can be selected for assets.

IsRequired.description: Indicates whether the attribute definition is required for an asset.

Label.description: The label for the attribute. Displays a friendly name for the attribute, for example, threshold monitor lightning component and recordset filter criteria rule.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date the attribute definition was last referenced.

LastViewedDate.description: The date the attribute definition was last viewed.

Name.description: The name of the attribute.

OwnerId.description: The owner of the attribute definition.

PicklistId.description: The ID of the attribute picklist with the valid values for this attribute.

SourceSystemIdentifier.description: The identifier of the attribute definition in an external system.

UnitOfMeasureId.description: The ID of the measurement unit for this attribute.

AttributePicklist.name: AttributePicklist
AttributePicklist.description: Represents a custom picklist for an asset attribute.

DataType.description: The data type of this picklist.

Description.description: A description of the picklist. Maximum size is 32000 alphanumeric characters. Can include the following special characters: @! - < > * ? + = % # ( ) / \ & ‘ £ € $ ”.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date the attribute picklist was last referenced.

LastViewedDate.description: The date the attribute picklist was last viewed.

Name.description: The name of the picklist. Names must be unique.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the owner of the attribute picklist record.

Status.description: The status of the attribute picklist.

UnitOfMeasureId.description: The ID of the unit of measure associated with the product.

AttributePicklistValue.name: AttributePicklistValue
AttributePicklistValue.description: Represents the values of an asset attribute picklist.

Abbreviation.description: A short name of the picklist value that's displayed at run time. Use up to 255 alphanumeric characters. Can include the following special characters: @ ! - < > * ? + = % # ( ) / \ & ‘ £ € $ ”.

Code.description: A picklist value code unique to the picklist. Maximum size is 80 alphanumeric characters. Can include the following special characters: @ ! - < > * ? + = % # ( ) / \ & ‘ £ € $ ”.

DisplayValue.description: The displayed picklist value if it’s different from the Name field. For example, the Name ‘5’ could have a DisplayValue ‘Five’.

IsDefault.description: Indicates whether the picklist value is the default for the associated picklist. Only one value can be the default for a picklist.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date the attribute picklist value was last referenced.

LastViewedDate.description: The date the attribute picklist value was last viewed.

Name.description: The name of the attribute picklist value.

PicklistId.description: The ID of the picklist that the value is associated with.

Sequence.description: The order in which the picklist value appears in the picklist.

Status.description: The status of the attribute picklist value.

Value.description: The text value for a picklist item if the picklist data type is text. This value must be unique within a picklist. Maximum size is 255 alphanumeric characters. Can include the following special characters: @ ! - < > * ? + = % # ( ) / \ & ‘ £ € $ ”.

ContractLineItem.name: ContractLineItem
ContractLineItem.description: Represents a product covered by a service contract (customer support agreement).

AssetId.description: Required. ID of the Asset associated with the contract line item. Must be a valid asset ID.

Description.description: Description of the contract line item.

Discount.description: The discount for the product as a percentage.

EndDate.description: The last day the contract line item is in effect.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

LineItemNumber.description: Automatically-generated number that identifies the contract line item.

ListPrice.description: Corresponds to the UnitPrice on the PricebookEntry that is associated with this line item, which can be in the standard pricebook or a custom pricebook. A client application can use this information to show whether the unit price (or sales price) of the line item differs from the pricebook entry list price.

LocationId.description: The location associated with the contract line item.

ParentContractLineItemId.description: The line item’s parent line item, if it has one.

PricebookEntryId.description: Required. ID of the associated PricebookEntry.

Product2Id.description: The product related to the contract line item.

Quantity.description: Number of units of the contract line item (product) included in the associated service contract.

RootContractLineItemId.description: (Read only) The top-level line item in a contract line item hierarchy. Depending on where a line item lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent.

ServiceContractId.description: Required. ID of the ServiceContract associated with the contract line item. Must be a valid service contract ID.

StartDate.description: The first day the contract line item is in effect.

Status.description: Status of the contract line item.

Subtotal.description: Contract line item's sales price multiplied by the Quantity.

TotalPrice.description: This field is available only for backward compatibility. It represents the total price of the ContractLineItem

UnitPrice.description: The unit price for the contract line item. In the user interface, this field’s value is calculated by dividing the total price of the contract line item by the quantity listed for that line item. Label is Sales Price.

ContractLineOutcome.name: ContractLineOutcome
ContractLineOutcome.description: Represents information on a contract line outcome’s captured data and other related parameters that are used when capturing data.

CalculationMethod.description: The method used for calculating the contract line outcome’s captured data to determine the outcome value. Select Average or As Captured to calculate the contract line outcome. Average calculates the outcome value based on the average of all data captured to date. As Captured calculates the outcome value based on the asset’s current data at the time of the compliance check.

CaptureFrequency.description: The frequency at which data capturing and contract compliance check for the contract line outcome occurs.

ComplianceStatus.description: Indicates if the criteria were met. Compliant–The outcome is compliant with the contract. Not Compliant–The outcome isn’t compliant with the contract. Not Available–The outcome’s compliance information isn’t available yet. Invalid–The outcome isn’t valid because the option selected for the Criteria Field of the recordset filter criteria was deleted. To restart the calculation, create a new contract line outcome.

ContractLineItemId.description: The contract line item associated with the contract line outcome.

Description.description: A description of the contract line outcome.

EndDate.description: The contract line outcome's data capture end date.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date and time when the contract line outcome was last modified. Its UI label is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date and time when the contract line outcome was last viewed.

Name.description: The name of the contract line outcome.

NextDataCaptureDate.description: The date of the next data capture and compliance check based on the capture frequency. The date is auto-populated and updated after each capture

OwnerId.description: The contract line outcome’s owner. By default, the owner is the user who created the contract line outcome record. Its UI label is Contract Line Outcome Owner.

RecordsetFilterCriteriaId.description: The ID of the recordset filter criteria in which the contract line outcome’s conditions are defined.

ServiceContractId.description: The service contract associated with the contract line item and the contract line outcome.

StartDate.description: The contract line outcome's data capture start date.

ContractLineOutcomeData.name: ContractLineOutcomeData
ContractLineOutcomeData.description: Represents the contract line outcome’s captured data. It stores the data that was captured between the contract line outcome’s start date and end date. This object is available in API version 58.0 and later.

CalculatedValue.description: The value calculated based on the contract line outcome’s calculation method and the captured data.

CaptureDate.description: The date and time when the data was captured.

ContractLineOutcomeId.description: The contract line outcome associated with the contract line outcome data record.

KeyPerformanceIndicator.description: The key performance indicators (fields or asset attributes) that define the contract line outcome’s compliance status.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date and time when the contract line outcome data record was last modified. Its UI label is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date and time when the contract line outcome data record was last viewed.

Name.description: The name of the contract line outcome data record.

Value.description: The actual value of the key performance indicator.

DigitalSignature.name: DigitalSignature
DigitalSignature.description: Represents a signature captured on a service report in field service.

DigitalSignatureNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the signature.

DocumentContentType.description: The data type of the captured signature. Possible values are: audio/ogg video/3gpp2 video/3gpp image/avif text/calendar audio/x-caf image/webp

DocumentLength.description: The length of the captured signature.

DocumentName.description: The name of the captured signature image.

ParentId.description: ID of the service appointment, work order, or work order line item that the service report is generated for.

Place.description: The place where the report was signed.

SignatureType.description: The role of the person signing the service report. Your org comes with one signature type, Default. A service report template can only contain one signature per type. If you plan to collect multiple signatures on service reports, create additional values for the Signature Type field.Create at least one value for every role that might need to sign a service report. For example, Technician, Customer, Supervisor, or Supplier. If some service reports will be signed by multiple people in one role—for example, all technicians present at an appointment—create numbered types: Technician 1, Technician 2, and so forth. Note You can create up to 1,000 signature types. You can’t delete signature types, but you can deactivate them so they can’t be used in service report templates. When you deactivate a type, it still appears on service report templates that used it, but you can’t use it on new service report templates.

SignedBy.description: The name of the person signing.

SignedDate.description: The date and time of the signing.

Entitlement.name: Entitlement
Entitlement.description: Represents the customer support an account or contact is eligible to receive.

AccountId.description: ID of the Account associated with the entitlement.

AssetId.description: Required. ID of the Asset associated with the entitlement. Must be a valid asset ID.

AssetWarrantyID.description: The identifier of the asset warranty record. Must be a valid asset warranty ID. AssetWarranty is available only with Field Service.

BusinessHoursId.description: Required. ID of the BusinessHours associated with the entitlement. Must be a valid business hours ID.

CasesPerEntitlement.description: The total number of cases the entitlement supports.

ContractLineItemId.description: Required. ID of the ContractLineItem associated with the entitlement. Must be a valid ID.

EndDate.description: The last day the entitlement is in effect.

IsPerIncident.description: Indicates whether the entitlement is limited to supporting a specific number of cases (true) or not (false).

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

LocationID.description: ID of the Location associated with the entitlement. Must be a valid location ID.

Name.description: Required. Name of the entitlement.

SvcApptBookingWindowsId.description: The operating hours that the entitlement’s work orders should respect. The label in the user interface is Operating Hours. Available only if Field Service is enabled.

RemainingCases.description: The number of cases the entitlement can support. This field decreases in value by one each time a case is created with the entitlement.

RemainingWorkOrders.description: The number of agreed work orders remaining to be created.

ServiceContractId.description: Required. ID of the ServiceContract associated with the entitlement. Must be a valid ID.

SlaProcessId.description: ID of the SlaProcess associated with the entitlement. This field is available in version 19.0 and later.

StartDate.description: The first date the entitlement is in effect.

Status.description: Status of the entitlement, such as Expired.

SvcApptBookingWindows.description: The operating hours of the entitlement. This field is visible only if Field Service is enabled.

Type.description: The type of entitlement, such as Web or phone support.

WorkOrdersPerEntitlement.description: Total number of work orders available for this entitlement.

EntityMilestone.name: EntityMilestone
EntityMilestone.description: Represents a required step in a customer support process on a work order. The Salesforce user interface uses the term “object milestone.

ActualElapsedTimeInDays.description: The number of days that it took to complete a milestone. (Elapsed Time) – (Stopped Time) = (Actual Elapsed Time) Note To display this field, select Enable stopped time and actual elapsed time on the Entitlement Settings page and add the field to the object milestone page layout.

ActualElapsedTimeInHrs.description: The number of hours that it took to complete a milestone. (Elapsed Time) – (Stopped Time) = (Actual Elapsed Time) Note To display this field, select Enable stopped time and actual elapsed time on the Entitlement Settings page and add the field to the object milestone page layout.

ActualElapsedTimeInMins.description: The number of minutes that it took to complete a milestone. (Elapsed Time) – (Stopped Time) = (Actual Elapsed Time) Note To display this field, select Enable stopped time and actual elapsed time on the Entitlement Settings page and add the field to the object milestone page layout.

BusinessHoursId.description: The business hours on the milestone. If business hours aren’t specified, the entitlement process business hours are used. If business hours are also not specified on the entitlement process, the business hours on the record are used.

CompletionDate.description: The date and time the milestone was completed.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

ElapsedTimeInDays.description: The number of days it took to complete a milestone, including time during which the milestone was stopped. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record. Elapsed time is calculated only after the Completion Date field is populated. (Elapsed Time) – (Stopped Time) = (Actual Elapsed Time).

ElapsedTimeInHrs.description: The number of hours it took to complete a milestone, including time during which the milestone was stopped. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record. Elapsed time is calculated only after the Completion Date field is populated. (Elapsed Time) – (Stopped Time) = (Actual Elapsed Time).

ElapsedTimeInMins.description: The number of minutes it took to complete a milestone, including time during which the milestone was stopped. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record. Elapsed time is calculated only after the Completion Date field is populated. (Elapsed Time) – (Stopped Time) = (Actual Elapsed Time).

IsCompleted.description: Green checkmark icon that indicates a milestone completion.

IsViolated.description: Red exclamation point icon that indicates a milestone violation.

MilestoneTypeId.description: The ID of the milestone (for instance, First Response).

Name.description: The name of the milestone.

ParentEntityId.description: The ID of the record—for example, a work order—that contains the milestone.

SlaProcessId.description: The entitlement process associated with the milestone.

StartDate.description: The date and time that milestone tracking started.

StoppedTimeInDays.description: The number of days that an agent has been blocked from completing a milestone. For example, an agent may be waiting for a customer to reply with more information. Note To display this field, select Enable stopped time and actual elapsed time on the Entitlement Settings page and add the field to the object milestone page layout.

StoppedTimeInHrs.description: The number of hours that an agent has been blocked from completing a milestone. For example, an agent may be waiting for a customer to reply with more information. Note To display this field, select Enable stopped time and actual elapsed time on the Entitlement Settings page and add the field to the object milestone page layout.

StoppedTimeInMins.description: The number of minutes that an agent has been blocked from completing a milestone. For example, an agent may be waiting for a customer to reply with more information. Note To display this field, select Enable stopped time and actual elapsed time on the Entitlement Settings page and add the field to the object milestone page layout.

TargetDate.description: The date and time to complete the milestone.

TargetResponseInDays.description: The number of days to complete the milestone. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record.

TargetResponseInHrs.description: The number of hours to complete the milestone. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record.

TargetResponseInMins.description: The number of minutes to complete the milestone. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record.

TimeRemainingInDays.description: The days that remain before a milestone violation. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record.

TimeRemainingInHrs.description: The hours that remain before a milestone violation. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record.

TimeRemainingInMins.description: The minutes that remain before a milestone violation. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record.

TimeSinceTargetInDays.description: The days that have elapsed since a milestone violation. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record.

TimeSinceTargetInHrs.description: The hours that have elapsed since a milestone violation. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record.

TimeSinceTargetInMins.description: The minutes that have elapsed since a milestone violation. Automatically calculated to include the business hours on the record.

Expense.name: Expense
Expense.description: Represents an expense linked to a work order. Service resource technicians can log expenses, such as tools or travel costs.

AccountId.description: The ID of the account associated with the linked work order.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

Description.description: A description for the expense.

Discount.description: The percentage deducted from the Subtotal price. Available in version 51.0 and later.

ExpenseEndDate.description: If the expense was incurred over multiple days, the Expense End Date is the last day that the expense covers.

ExpenseNumber.description: The number that uniquely identifies the expense.

ExpenseStartDate.description: If the expense was incurred over multiple days, the Expense Start Date is the first day that the expense covers.

ExpenseType.description: The type of expense. Possible values are: Billable Non-Billable The default value is Billable.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who owns the expense record.

Quantity.description: The number of items purchased in this record. Available in version 51.0 and later.

Subtotal.description: The subtotal price calculated as the product of Quantity and UnitPrice. Available in version 51.0 and later.

Title.description: A title that identifies the expense.

TotalPrice.description: The total price of the transaction which is equal to the discounted subtotal: Subtotal - (Discount * Subtotal). Available in version 51.0 and later.

TransactionDate.description: The day that the expense was incurred, or the payment date for the expense.

UnitPrice.description: The price of one item on the record. Available in version 51.0 and later.

WorkOrderId.description: The ID of the work order associated with the expense.

ExpenseReport.name: ExpenseReport
ExpenseReport.description: Represents a report that summarizes expenses.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

Description.description: A description for the expense report.

ExpenseReportNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the expense report.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who owns the expense report record.

Title.description: A title that identifies the expense report.

TotalExpenseAmount.description: The sum of all expense entries in the report.

ExpenseReportEntry.name: ExpenseReportEntry
ExpenseReportEntry.description: Represents an entry in an expense report.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

ExpenseId.description: The expense that corresponds to the expense report entry.

ExpenseReportEntryNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the expense report entry.

ExpenseReportId.description: The expense report that’s associated with the expense report entry.

ExpenseType.description: The type of expense. Possible values are: Billable Non-Billable The default value is Billable.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

Title.description: A title that identifies the expense.

TransactionDate.description: The day that the expense was incurred, or the payment date for the expense.

FieldServiceMobileSettings.name: FieldServiceMobileSettings
FieldServiceMobileSettings.description: Represents a configuration of settings that control the Field Service iOS and Android mobile app experience.

AscAutomaticMode.description: Describes how status changes are handled. Possible values are: Off—No automatic status changes. Manual—The mobile worker can cancel or update the status change. Timed—The mobile worker has a time period to prevent the status change. When the timer ends, the status changes. Automated—The mobile worker is notified that the status has changed.

AscCancellationTimerInSec.description: For the Timed mode only. Time that the user has to cancel the appointment status change.

AscCompletedStatus.description: Status that indicates that a mobile worker completed a service appointment. Possible values are: Canceled Cannot Complete Completed Dispatched In Progress None Scheduled

AscOnSiteStatus.description: Status that indicates that a mobile worker is at a service appointment. Possible values are: Canceled Cannot Complete Completed Dispatched In Progress None Scheduled

AscRadiusInMeters.description: Service appointment radius that can trigger a status change.

AscTimeLimitationInMin.description: A time period when status changes can occur, before an appointment’s scheduled start time and after the scheduled end time. The time is applied only if IsAscTimeLimitEnabled is true.

AscTravelStatus.description: Status that indicates that a mobile worker is traveling to a service appointment. Possible values are: Canceled Cannot Complete Completed Dispatched In Progress None Scheduled

BgGeoLocationAccuracy.description: The accuracy of geolocation tracking of services resources while the app is running in the background. Lowering accuracy reduces battery consumption for mobile devices. Available in API version 41.0 and later. Picklist options: Medium—Accurate to within about 100 meters. Coarse—Accurate to within about 1 kilometer. Very Coarse—Accurate to within about 3 kilometers.

BgGeoLocationMinUpdateFreqMins.description: The frequency of geolocation poling of services resources while the app is running in the background. Less frequent poling decreases battery consumption for mobile devices. The label in the UI is Minimum Update Frequency of Geo Location in Minutes (Background). Available in API version 41.0 and later.

BrandInvertedColor.description: The color of toasts and the contrast color of the floating action button.

ContrastInvertedColor.description: The color of secondary backgrounds in the UI.

ContrastQuaternaryColor.description: The color of secondary lines that delineate different areas of the UI.

ContrastQuinaryColor.description: The color of primary backgrounds in the UI.

ContrastTertiaryColor.description: The color of the icons on the settings screen and of primary lines that delineate different areas of the UI.

DaysBeforeCurrentServiceDate.description: Days before the current service date during which to prime service documents for offline use.

DayAfterCurrentServiceDate.description: Days after the current service date during which to prime service documents for offline use.

DefaultListViewDeveloperName.description: The API name of the default service appointment list view on the schedule screen.

DestinationType.description: Determines if the mobile worker navigates to the destination based on the address or based on the latitude and longitude. Possible values are: Address Latitude and Longitude

DeveloperName.description: The API name of the set of field service mobile settings.

FeedbackSelectedColor.description: The color indicating the user’s current selection.

FutureDaysInDatePicker.description: The number of days into the future that a user can select from the date picker on the schedule screen.

GeoLocationAccuracy.description: The accuracy of service resource geolocation tracking. Lowering accuracy reduces battery consumption for mobile devices. Picklist values: Fine—Accurate to within 10 meters. Medium—Accurate to within 100 meters. Coarse—Accurate to within 1 kilometer.

GeoLocationMinUpdateFreqMins.description: The minimum number of minutes between attempts to poll geolocation.

IsAscTimeLimitEnabled.description: Indicates whether AscTimeLimitationInMin is applied. Default is true

IsAssignmentNotification.description: Controls whether service appointment notifications are sent when the service resource is assigned the appointment. Default is false. This field is available in API version 46.0 and later.

IsDefault.description: Indicates that the set of field service mobile settings is the default set that is automatically assigned to users. You can’t make a different settings record the default, but you can modify the default settings record. Default is false. Available in API version 41.0 and later.

IsDispatchNotification.description: Controls whether service appointment notifications are sent when the service resource is dispatched for the appointment. Default is false. This field is available in API version 46.0 and later.

IsLimitedLocTrackingEnabled.description: When limited tracking for Appointment Assistant is enabled, the mobile worker’s location is shown only on the way to a service appointment. The default value is false.

IsOptimizedImageUploadEnabled.description: Indicates whether to configure the size of images uploaded by your mobile workers. To optimize upload speeds, you can limit your file size to a defined maximum size using the OptimizeImageSizeInMb field. Resizing your images affects the resolution of your images. The default value is false.

IsScheduleViewResourceAbsences.description: Determines whether resource absences appear in the Schedule tab of the mobile app. This field is available in API version 55.0 and later.

IsSendLocationHistory.description: Controls whether geolocation tracking of services resources is enabled. Default is false.

IsShowEditFullRecord.description: Controls whether users can edit records with the field service mobile app. Default is false.

IsTimeSheetEnabled.description: Controls whether users can access time sheets on their mobile devices (Beta). Default is false.

IsTimeZoneEnabled.description: Controls whether the time zone of timesheet entries on the mobile app is recorded. The current time zone is recorded in the LocationTimeZone field of the TimeSheetEntry object. Default is false. Available in API version 50.0 and later.

Language.description: The localization preference for a user. The format is a two letter language code and, if there’s a dialect, followed by the two letter dialect, for example, fr for French, and fr_BE for Belgian French

MasterLabel.description: The label in the UI for the set of field service mobile settings. Available in API version 41.0 and later.

MaxNumberOfServiceAppointments.description: Sets the maximum number of service appointments to use for offline priming of service documents. If you don’t have dates on your service appointments, this setting helps to optimize offline priming in place of DaysBeforeCurrentServiceDate and DaysBeforeCurrentServiceDate fields.

MetadataCacheTimeDays.description: The number of days that org metadata, such as layouts, is kept in the app’s local cache of memory.

NavbarBackgroundColor.description: The color of the top bar in the app.

NavbarInvertedColor.description: The secondary color of the tap bar in the app.

OptimizeImageSizeInMb.description: Configure the size of images uploaded by your mobile workers. To optimize upload speeds, you can limit your file size to a defined maximum size. Resizing your images affects the resolution of your images. Enter 0.2 or higher. Used only if IsOptimizedImageUploadEnabled is true.

PastDaysInDatePicker.description: The number of days into the past that a user can select from the date picker on the schedule screen.

PrimaryBrandColor.description: The main branding color used throughout the UI.

QuickStatusChangeFlowName.description: The name of an existing Field Service flow with a Quick Status Change action to change the work order or service appointment status or both. This applies to flows invoked on the mobile app only. This field is available in API version 51.0 and later.

RecordDataCacheTimeMins.description: The number of minutes that record data is kept in the app’s local cache of memory.

TimeIntervalSetupMins.description: Controls the spacing of picklist options for time values such as when creating resource absences.

UpdateScheduleTimeMins.description: The minimum number of minutes between attempts to update a user’s schedule.The user’s schedule might not refresh on this cadence if the user’s device isn’t connected to a network or doesn’t have adequate battery life.

FldSvcObjChg.name: FldSvcObjChg
FldSvcObjChg.description: Represents a change made to one of a service appointment’s tracked fields.

Activity.description: The available scheduling activities for the service appointment.

ActivityDetails.description: Details about the scheduling activity such as the scheduling policy that was used and the unscheduling reason (when applicable).

ActivityTimeStamp.description: Date and time of when the change to the service appointment was made.

IsPrimary.description: Indicates whether the change was made directly to the service appointment or indirectly. If the change was made directly to the appointment, it’s flagged as Primary. If it was made to another appointment and affected this one, it’s flagged as Secondary.

OriginalSvcAppointment.description: The ID of the service appointment that was changed. The field value isn’t deleted when the Service Appointment object is deleted.

ServiceAppointmentId.description: The ID of the service appointment that was changed. Because this is a relationship field, the field value is deleted when the Service Appointment object is deleted.

TimeZone.description: The time zone of the service appointment or the assigned resource.

Transaction.description: The last transaction ID of the scheduling and optimization request that updated this object. The transaction ID is automatically generated and populated by the Enhanced Scheduling and Optimization engine.

UserId.description: The user who made the change to the service appointment. If an activity is a scheduled job, it’s registered with the System Administrator user who configured it.

FldSvcObjChgDtl.name: FldSvcObjChgDtl
FldSvcObjChgDtl.description: Represents the details of a change made to one of a service appointment’s tracked fields.

FieldChangedName.description: The API name of the field that was changed.

FieldChangedValue.description: The updated value of the field that was changed.

FldSvcObjChgId.description: The parent record associated with the details of the change. The parent record has multiple detail records associated with it. Each record includes the name and the current value of the tracked fields.

FSL__Time_Dependency__c.name: FSL__Time_Dependency__c
FSL__Time_Dependency__c.description: Represents a dependency between two service appointments. This object is used to define scheduling relationships between two appointments. It allows you to determine the order and timing in which dependent appointments should be scheduled.

FSL__Root_Service_Appointment__c.description: The service appointment that’s the root appointment of the entire dependency chain. The root appointment is the same service appointment for all the dependencies in the chain. This field is automatically populated by the system when creating a dependency. When creating a dependency via API, the API user must have permissions for this field. We recommend leaving this field empty when a dependency is created and avoiding any custom modifications.

FSL__Same_Resource__c.description: An indication of whether the two service appointments that share a dependency should be assigned to the same service resource.

FSL__Service_Appointment_1__c.description: The first service appointment on which the second service appointment is dependent.

FSL__Service_Appointment_2__c.description: The second service appointment that’s dependent on the first service appointment.

Name.description: An auto-generated unique identifier for the appointment dependency record.

GeolocationBasedAction.name: GeolocationBasedAction
GeolocationBasedAction.description: Represents a geolocation-based action, which is an action that’s triggered when a user enters, exits, or is within the area of the associated object.

ActionData.description: The details of the selected action type.

Description.description: The description of the action.

InitialTimeInvoked.description: Captures the first time the mobile worker invoked this action.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

LastTimeInvoked.description: Captures the last time the mobile worker invoked this action.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, and LastReferenceDate isn’t null, the user accessed this record or list view indirectly.

Name.description: The name of the action.

OwnerId.description: ID of the owner of this object.

Radius.description: The distance in meters from the location of the associated object that triggers the action.

ReferenceRecordId.description: The ID of the record that the action is associated with.

TriggerType.description: The event that triggered this action.

LinkedArticle.name: LinkedArticle
LinkedArticle.description: Represents a knowledge article that is attached to a work order, work order line item, or work type.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization.

KnowledgeArticleId.description: The ID of the Knowledge article attached to the record. The label in the user interface is Knowledge Article ID.

KnowledgeArticleVersionId.description: The version of the Knowledge article attached to the record. This field lists the title of the attached version and links to the version. The label in the user interface is Article Version.When you attach an article to a work order, that version of the article stays associated with the work order, even if later versions are published. If needed, you can detach and reattach an article to a work order to link the latest version.

LinkedEntityId.description: The ID of the record that the Knowledge article is attached to. The label in the user interface is Linked Record ID.

Name.description: The title of the article. The label in the user interface is Article Title.

RecordTypeId.description: The ID of the article’s record type, if used. This field is only available for Lightning Knowledge.

Type.description: (Read only) The type of record that the Knowledge article is attached to. For example, work order. The label in the user interface is Linked Object Type.

Location.name: Location
Location.description: Represents a warehouse, service vehicle, work site, or other element of the region where your team performs field service work. In API version 49.0 and later, you can associate activities with specific locations. Activities, such as the tasks and events related to a location, appear in the activities timeline when you view the location detail page. Also in API version 49.0 and later, Work.com users can view Employees as a related list on Location records. In API version 51.0 and later, this object is available for Omnichannel Inventory and represents physical locations where inventory is available for fulfilling orders.

AssignedFoCount.description: The number of fulfillment orders assigned to the location. Confirming held fulfillment order capacity increments this value. To reset the location’s capacity, set this value to 0.

CloseDate.description: Date the location closed or went out of service.

ConstructionEndDate.description: Date construction ended at the location.

ConstructionStartDate.description: Date construction began at the location.

DefaultPickupTime.description: Default pickup time at the location.

DefaultProcessingTime.description: Default processing time at the location.

DefaultProcessingTimeUnit.description: Default processing time unit at the location. Possible values are: Hours Days Weeks

Description.description: A brief description of the location.

EarliestPickupTimeOffset.description: The earliest pickup time for BOPIS. This value is measured in minutes after the start of business hours.

FoCapacity.description: The maximum number of fulfillment orders that can be assigned to the location per time period. If this value is null, then this location’s capacity isn’t limited.

FulfillingBusinessHours.description: Fulfilling business hours at the location.

IsEligibleForPickup.description: Indicates whether the location supports BOPIS

IsInventoryLocation.description: Indicates whether the location stores parts. Note This field must be selected if you want to associate the location with product items.

IsMobile.description: Indicates whether the location moves. For example, a truck or tool box.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the location was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date the location was last viewed.

LatestPickupTimeOffset.description: The latest pickup time for BOPIS. This value is measured in minutes before the end of business hours.
