ActivationDate.description: The initial day the service contract went into effect (whereas StartDate may include a renewal date).

AdditionalDiscount.description: Extra discount percentage for the service contract. Available in API version 55.0 and later.

ApprovalStatus.description: Approval status of the service contract.

BillingAddress (beta).description: The compound form of the billing address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

BillingCity.description: Details for the billing address. Maximum size is 40 characters.

BillingCountry.description: Details for the billing address. Maximum size is 40 characters.

BillingCountryCode.description: The ISO country code for the service contract’s billing address.

BillingLatitude.description: Used with BillingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places.

BillingLongitude.description: Used with BillingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of a billing address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places.

BillingPostalCode.description: Details for the billing address. Maximum size is 20 characters.

BillingState.description: Details for the billing address. Maximum size is 20 characters.

BillingStateCode.description: The ISO state code for the service contract’s billing address.

BillingStreet.description: Street address for the billing address.

ContactId.description: Required. ID of the Contact associated with the service contract. Must be a valid ID.

ContractNumber.description: Unique number automatically assigned to the service contract.

Description.description: Description of the service contract.

Discount.description: Discount percentage for the service contract.

EndDate.description: The last day the service contract is in effect.

GrandTotal.description: Total price of the service contract plus shipping and taxes.

IsDeleted.description: Indicates whether the object has been moved to the Recycle Bin (true) or not (false). Label is Deleted.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last interacted with this record, directly or indirectly. Some sample scenarios are:

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it’s possible that the user only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate), but not viewed it.

LineItemCount.description: Number of ContractLineItem records associated with the service contract.

Name.description: Name of the service contract.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who currently owns the service contract.

ParentServiceContractId.description: The service contract’s parent service contract, if it has one.

Pricebook2Id.description: ID of the Pricebook2 associated with the service contract. Must be a valid ID.

RootServiceContractId.description: (Read only) The top-level service contract in a service contract hierarchy. Depending on where a service contract lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent.

ShippingAddress (beta).description: The compound form of the shipping address. Read-only. See Address Compound Fields for details on compound address fields.

ShippingCity.description: Details of the shipping address. Maximum size is 40 characters.

ShippingCountry.description: Details of the shipping address. Country maximum size is 40 characters.

ShippingCountryCode.description: The ISO country code for the service contract’s shipping address.

ShippingLatitude.description: Used with ShippingLongitude to specify the precise geolocation of a shipping address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places.

ShippingLongitude.description: Used with ShippingLatitude to specify the precise geolocation of an address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places.

ShippingPostalCode.description: Details of the shipping address. Postal code maximum size is 20 characters.

ShippingState.description: Details of the shipping address. State maximum size is 20 characters.

ShippingStateCode.description: The ISO state code for the service contract’s shipping address.

ShippingStreet.description: The street address of the shipping address. Maximum of 255 characters.

SpecialTerms.description: Any terms specifically agreed to and tracked in the service contract.

StartDate.description: The first day the service contract is in effect.

Status.description: The status of the service contract, such as Inactive.

Subtotal.description: Total of the service contract line items (products) before discounts, taxes, and shipping are applied.

Tax.description: Total taxes for the service contract.

Term.description: Number of months that the service contract is valid.

TotalPrice.description: Total of the contract line items (products) after discounts and before taxes and shipping.

ServiceCrew.name: ServiceCrew
ServiceCrew.description: Represents a group of service resources who can be assigned to service appointments as a unit.

CrewSize.description: The number of members on the crew. This field is manual, so it doesn’t auto-update when you add or remove members.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the service crew was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the service crew was last viewed.

Name.description: The name of the service crew. For example, Repair Crew.

OwnerId.description: The crew owner. By default, the owner is the person who created the service crew.

ServiceCrewMember.name: ServiceCrewMember
ServiceCrewMember.description: Represents a technician service resource that belongs to a service crew.

EndDate.description: The last day that the service resource belongs to the crew. You can use this field to track employment dates for contractors.

IsLeader.description: Indicates that the member is the crew leader.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the service crew member was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the service crew member was last viewed.

ServiceCrewId.description: The crew that the service resource belongs to.

ServiceCrewMemberNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the service crew member.

ServiceResourceId.description: The service resource that belongs to the crew. Only service resources whose resource type is Technician can be added to service crews.

StartDate.description: Required. The day the service resource joins the crew. Service resources can belong to multiple crews as long as their start and end dates don’t overlap.

ServiceReport.name: ServiceReport
ServiceReport.description: Represents a report that summarizes a work order, work order line item, or service appointment.

ContentVersionDocumentId.description: ID of the service report version, used for storage.

DocumentBody.description: The report output. DocumentBody can’t be retrieved via REST API.

DocumentContentType.description: The type of data used for the report output.. Possible values are: audio/ogg text/calendar video/3gpp2 video/3gpp image/avif text/calendar audio/x-caf image/webp

DocumentLength.description: The length of the report output.

DocumentName.description: The name of the report output, always set to Service Report.

DocumentTemplate.description: The template used to generate service documents for the Document Builder feature. Important DocumentTemplate is different from Template. The document template needs to reference a flexipage that is of type serviceDocument and must target the object used to generate the service document. For example, you can't use an Account flexipage for a service report tied to a work order.

IsSigned.description: Indicates whether the service report contains one or more signatures. This field isn’t supported for Document Builder. Tip Add this field to the Service Reports related list on work orders, work order line items, and service appointments.

ParentId.description: The ID of the service appointment, work order, or work order line item that the service report summarizes. For example, if you click Create Service Report on a service appointment, this field lists the service appointment’s record ID.

ServiceReportLanguage.description: The language used for the service report. The language is selected in the ServiceReportLanguage field on the associated work order. If the work order doesn’t specify a service report language, the report is translated in the default language in Salesforce of the person generating the report.

ServiceReportNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the service report.

Status.description: The status of the service report. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

Template.description: The service report template used to generate the service report. Note If the person creating the service report doesn’t have access to certain objects or fields that are included in the service report template, those fields aren’t visible in the report they create.

ServiceReportLayout.name: ServiceReportLayout
ServiceReportLayout.description: Represents a service report template in field service.

DeveloperName.description: The developer name of the service report template.

Language.description: The language that the service report template uses.

LastViewedDate.description: The date the service report template was last viewed.

MasterLabel.description: The name of the service report template. For example, Maintenance Report Template.

TemplateType.description: The type of the service report template. Available in API version 46.0 and later.

ServiceResource.name: ServiceResource
ServiceResource.description: Represents a service technician or service crew in Field Service and Salesforce Scheduler, or an agent in Workforce Engagement.

Description.description: The description of the resource.

IsActive.description: When selected, this option means that the resource can be assigned to work orders. For service tracking purposes, resources can’t be deleted, so deactivating a resource is the best way to send them into retirement.Deactivating a user doesn’t deactivate the related service resource. You can’t create a service resource that is linked to an inactive user.

IsCapacityBased.description: Capacity-based resources are limited to a certain number of hours or appointments in a specified time period. Tip The Capacities related list shows a resource’s capacity.

IsOptimizationCapable.description: This field is reserved for Field Service and the managed package. Create a custom field instead of using this field to include a service resource in optimization.

LastKnownLatitude.description: The latitude of the last known location.

LastKnownLongitude.description: The longitude of the last known location.

LastKnownLocation.description: The service resource’s last known location. You can configure this field to display data collected from a custom mobile app. This field isn’t visible in the user interface, but you can expose it on service resource page layouts or set up field tracking to be able to view a resource’s location history.

LastKnownLocationDate.description: The date and time of the last known location.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the service resource was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the service resource was last viewed.

LocationId.description: The location associated with the service resource. For example, a service vehicle driven by the service resource.

Name.description: The resource’s name, for example the name or title of the associated user or service crew.

OwnerId.description: The owner of the service resource.

RelatedRecordId.description: The associated user. Its label in the UI is User. If the service resource represents a service crew rather than a user, leave the User field blank and select the related crew in the ServiceCrewId field.

ResourceType.description: Indicates whether the resource is a Technician (T), Dispatcher (D), Crew (C), Asset (S), Agent (A), or Planner (P). The default value is Technician (T). Resources who are dispatchers can’t be capacity-based or included in scheduling optimization. Only users with the Field Service Dispatcher permission-set license can be dispatchers. You can’t add additional resource types. To create a dependent lookup filter with ServiceResource.ResourceType, use only the first letter of the picklist value, for example T for Technician.

ServiceCrewId.description: The associated service crew. If the service resource represents a crew, select the crew. Note This field is hidden for all users by default. To use it, update its field-level security settings in Setup and add it to your service resource page layouts.

ServiceResourceCapacity.name: ServiceResourceCapacity
ServiceResourceCapacity.description: Represents the maximum number of scheduled hours or number of service appointments that a capacity-based service resource can complete within a specific time period.

CapacityInHours.description: The number of hours that the resource can work per time period. You must fill out this field, the CapacityInWorkItems field, or both.

CapacityInWorkItems.description: The total number of service appointments that the resource can complete per time period. You must fill out this field, the CapacityInHours field, or both.

CapacityNumber.description: (Read only) An auto-generated number identifying the capacity record.

EndDate.description: The date the capacity ends; for example, the end date of a contract.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

ServiceResourceId.description: The associated service resource. You can set multiple capacities for a resource as long as their start and end dates do not overlap.

StartDate.description: The date the capacity goes into effect.

TimePeriod.description: Days, Hours, or Months. For example, if a resource can work 80 hours per month, the capacity’s Time Period would be Month and Hours per Time Period would be 80.

ServiceResourceSkill.name: ServiceResourceSkill
ServiceResourceSkill.description: Represents a skill that a service resource possesses in Field Service and Lightning Scheduler.

EffectiveEndDate.description: The date when the skill expires. For example, if a service resource needs to be re-certified after six months, the end date would be the date their certification expires.

EffectiveStartDate.description: The date when the service resource gains the skill. For example, if the skill represents a certification, the start date would be the date of certification.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the resource skill was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the resource skill was last viewed.

ServiceResourceId.description: The service resource who possesses the skill.

SkillId.description: The skill the service resource possesses.

SkillLevel.description: The service resource’s skill level. Skill level can range from zero to 99.99.

SkillNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the resource skill assignment.

ServiceTerritory.name: ServiceTerritory
ServiceTerritory.description: Represents a geographic or functional region in which work can be performed in Field Service, Salesforce Scheduler, or Workforce Engagement.

Address.description: An address to associate with the territory. For example, you can list the address of the territory’s headquarters.

AvgTravelTime.description: The average travel time for this service territory. The value is added to the Work Capacity Usage for each scheduled service appointment in the service territory. Available in API version 59.0 and later.

City.description: The city of the associated address. Maximum length is 40 characters.

Country.description: The country to associate with the territory. Maximum length is 80 characters.

Description.description: The description of the territory.

GeocodeAccuracy.description: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. Usually provided by a geocoding service based on the address’s latitude and longitude coordinates.This field is available in the API only.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the service territory is meant to be used. If a territory is inactive, you can’t add members to it or link it to work orders, work order line items, or service appointments.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the territory was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the territory was last viewed.

Latitude.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address associated with the territory. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places.This field is available in the API only.

Longitude.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address associated with the territory. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places.This field is available in the API only.

Name.description: The name of the territory.

OperatingHoursId.description: The territory’s operating hours, which indicate when service appointments within the territory can occur. Service resources who are members of a territory automatically inherit the territory’s operating hours unless different hours are specified on the resource record.

ParentTerritoryId.description: The territory’s parent service territory, if it has one. For example, a Northern California territory can have a State of California territory as its parent. A service territory hierarchy can contain up to 10,000 territories.

PostalCode.description: The postal code of the address associated with the territory. Maximum length is 20 characters.

State.description: The state of the address associated with the territory. Maximum length is 80 characters.

Street.description: The street number and name of the address associated with the territory.

TopLevelTerritoryId.description: (Read only) The top-level territory in a hierarchy of service territories. Depending on where a territory lies in the hierarchy, its top-level territory can be the same as its parent.

TravelModeId.description: ID of the TravelMode used for travel time calculations. The travel mode includes information about the type of transportation, such as a car or walking, whether a vehicle can take toll roads, and whether a vehicle is transporting hazardous materials.

TravelTimeBuffer.description: Add additional time to driving time, such as time to find parking or to walk to the site. This value overrides the Travel Time Buffer value defined in Field Service Settings | Scheduling | Routing.

TypicalInTerritoryTravelTime.description: Estimated number of minutes needed to travel from one location to another within the service territory. You can use this field in Apex customization.

ServiceTerritoryLocation.name: ServiceTerritoryLocation
ServiceTerritoryLocation.description: Represents a location associated with a particular service territory in field service.

LocationId.description: The location that is associated with the service territory.

ServiceTerritoryLocationNumber.description: (Read only) Auto-generated number identifying the service territory location.

ServiceTerritoryMember.name: ServiceTerritoryMember
ServiceTerritoryMember.description: Represents a service resource who can be assigned in a service territory in Field Service, Salesforce Scheduler, or Workforce Engagement.

Address.description: The member’s address. You may want to list the related service resource’s address in this field.

City.description: The city of the member’s address. Maximum length is 40 characters.

Country.description: The country of the member’s address. Maximum length is 80 characters.

EffectiveEndDate.description: The date when the service resource is no longer a member of the territory. If the resource will be working in the territory for the foreseeable future, leave this field blank. This field is mainly useful for indicating when a temporary relocation ends.

EffectiveStartDate.description: The date when the service resource becomes a member of the service territory.

GeocodeAccuracy.description: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. Usually provided by a geocoding service based on the address’s latitude and longitude coordinates. Note This field is available in the API only.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the territory member was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the territory member was last viewed.

Latitude.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the member’s address. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places. Note This field is available in the API only.

Longitude.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the member’s address. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places. Note This field is available in the API only.

MemberNumber.description: (Read only) An auto-generated number identifying the service territory member.

OperatingHoursId.description: The operating hours assigned to the service territory member. If no operating hours are specified, the member is assumed to use their parent service territory’s operating hours. If a member needs special operating hours, create them in Setup and select them in the Operating Hours lookup field on the member’s detail page.

PostalCode.description: The postal code of the member’s address. Maximum length is 20 characters.

ServiceResourceId.description: The service resource assigned to the service territory.

ServiceTerritoryId.description: The service territory that the service resource is assigned to.

State.description: The state of the member’s address. Maximum length is 80 characters.

Street.description: The street number and name of the member’s address.

TerritoryType.description: Primary, Secondary, or Relocation. The primary territory is typically the territory where the resource works most often—for example, near their home base. Service resources can only have one primary territory. Secondary territories are territories where the resource can be assigned to appointments if needed. Service resources can have multiple secondary territories. Relocation territories represent temporary moves for service resources. If you’re using the Field Service managed packages with the scheduling optimizer, resources with relocation territories are always assigned to services within their relocation territories during the specified relocation dates; if they don’t have a relocation territory, the primary territories are favored over the secondary. For example, a service resource might have the following territories: Primary territory: West Chicago Secondary territories: East Chicago South Chicago Relocation territory: Manhattan, for a three-month period

TravelModeId.description: ID of the TravelMode used for travel time calculations. The travel mode includes information about the type of transportation, such as a car or walking, whether a vehicle can take toll roads, and whether a vehicle is transporting hazardous materials.

Shift.name: Shift
Shift.description: Represents a shift for service resource scheduling.

BackgroundColor.description: Sets a background color when shifts are displayed in the UI. Use a 3- or 6-digit hexadecimal format, for example #FF00FF. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

EndTime.description: The date and time that the shift ends.

IsHolidayShift.description: Indicates a shift that overlaps with holiday hours. The default value is false. Available in API version 55.0 and later.

IsNonStandard.description: Indicates whether the shift is nonstandard, such as overtime or on-call shifts.

JobProfileId.description: The job profile associated with the shift. Available in API versions 47.0 and later.

Label.description: The label that a shift is given.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date and time when the current user last viewed a related record.

LastViewedDate.description: The date and time when the current user last viewed this record.

OwnerId.description: The owner of the shift.

RecordsetFilterCriteriaId.description: The ID of the recordset filter criteria selected for the shift. Available in API version 49.0 and later.

ServiceResourceId.description: The ID of the service resource the shift belongs to. Available in API versions 47.0 and later.

ServiceTerritoryId.description: The ID of the service territory the shift belongs to. Available in API versions 47.0 and later.

ShiftNumber.description: The number automatically given to the shift upon creation.

ShiftTemplateId.description: The shift template ID, if the shift was created from a shift template. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

StartTime.description: The date and time that the shift starts.

Status.description: Describes the status of the shift. Users can create custom values. Default values are: Tentative Published Confirmed

StatusCategory.description: Describes the status of the shift using static values. This field is derived from Status using the mapping defined in setup.

TimeSlotType.description: Type of time slot for the shift. The same setup values as the TimeSlot field in the OperatingHours object.

ShiftPattern.name: ShiftPattern
ShiftPattern.description: Represents a pattern of templates for creating shifts.

Description.description: A short description of the shift pattern to help users identify the pattern.

IsActive.description: Indicates that the shift pattern can be used to create shifts.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date that the shift pattern was last used.

LastViewedDate.description: The date that the shift pattern was last viewed.

Name.description: A short, descriptive name of the shift pattern.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the owner of the shift pattern. Default is the user who creates the shift pattern.

PatternLength.description: The duration in days of the shift pattern.

ShiftPatternEntry.name: ShiftPatternEntry
ShiftPatternEntry.description: ShiftPatternEntry links a shift template to a shift pattern.

DayOrder.description: DayOrder links the shift template to the specific day within the shift pattern duration that the template. For example, if the DayOrder is 2 then a shift from the associated template is created on the second day of the pattern.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date that the shift pattern entry was last used.

LastViewedDate.description: The date that the shift pattern entry was last viewed.

Name.description: An auto-generated reference number for the shift pattern entry.

ShiftPatternId.description: The ID of the shift pattern that the shift pattern entry is linked to.

ShiftTemplateId.description: The ID of the shift template that’s used to create shifts for this shift pattern entry.

ShiftTemplate.name: ShiftTemplate
ShiftTemplate.description: Represents a template for creating shifts.

BackgroundColor.description: Sets a background color when shifts are displayed in the UI. Use a 3- or 6-digit hexadecimal format, for example #FF00FF. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

Description.description: Additional information about the shift like number of breaks or activities.

Duration.description: How long the shift lasts. The unit of measurement for this field is determined by ShiftTemplateDurationType.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the shift is active or inactive.

IsNonStandard.description: Indicates whether the shift is nonstandard, such as overtime or on-call shifts.

JobProfileId.description: The Job Profile record. This field is optional.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the shift template was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the shift template was last viewed.

Name.description: The shift template record name.

OwnerId.description: The owner of the shift template.

RecordsetFilterCriteriaId.description: The ID of the recordset filter criteria selected for the shift template. Available in API version 53.0 and later.

ShiftTemplateDurationType.description: The unit of measurement for the shift template duration.

StartTime.description: The time of day when the shift starts.

TimeSlotType.description: The type of time slot. Possible values are: Normal Extended You can use Extended to represent overtime shifts. Available in API version 55.0 and later.

Shipment.name: Shipment
Shipment.description: Represents the transport of inventory in field service or a shipment of order items in Order Management.

DeliveredToId.description: The person or entity the product was delivered to.

DeliveryMethodId.description: The delivery method used for the shipment.

Description.description: Details not recorded in the provided fields

DestinationLocationId.description: The place the product is to be delivered.

ExpectedDeliveryDate.description: Date the product is expected to be delivered.

FulfillmentOrderId.description: The fulfillment order that the shipment belongs to.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last interacted with this record, directly or indirectly. Some sample scenarios are:

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it’s possible that the user only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate), but not viewed it.

OrderSummaryId.description: The order summary associated with the shipment.

OwnerId.description: The owner of the shipment.

Provider.description: The company or person making the transfer.

ReturnOrderId.description: For a return Shipment, the associated ReturnOrder.

ShipFromAddress.description: The place the product is coming from. The compound form of the ship to address. Read-only. For details on compound address fields, see Address Compound Fields.

ShipFromCity.description: The city of the address where the shipment originates.

ShipFromCountry.description: The country of the address where the shipment originates.

ShipFromGeocodeAccuracy.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the address where the shipment originates. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields. Note This field is available in the API only.

ShipFromLatitude.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the shipment originates. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields. Note This field is available in the API only.

ShipFromLongitude.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the shipment originates. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields. Note This field is available in the API only.

ShipFromPostalCode.description: The postal code of the address where the shipment originates.

ShipFromState.description: The state of the address where the shipment originates.

ShipFromStreet.description: The street of the address where the shipment originates.

ShipToAddress.description: The physical address where the shipment is delivered. The compound form of the ship to address. Read-only. For details on compound address fields, see Address Compound Fields.

ShipToCity.description: The city of the address where the shipment is delivered.

ShipToCountry.description: The country of the address where the shipment is delivered.

ShipToGeocodeAccuracy.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the address where the shipment is delivered. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields. Note This field is available in the API only.

ShipToLatitude.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the shipment is delivered. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields. Note This field is available in the API only.

ShipToLongitude.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the shipment is delivered. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields. Note This field is available in the API only.

ShipToPostalCode.description: The postal code of the address where the shipment is delivered.

ShipToState.description: The state of the address where the shipment is delivered.

ShipToStreet.description: The street of the address where the shipment is delivered.

ShipmentNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the shipment.

SourceLocationId.description: The field service location where the shipment originates.

Status.description: The status of the shipment. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: Created—Shipment has been created. Delivered—Shipment has been delivered. In Transit—Shipment is in transit. Shipped—Order has been shipped. Voided—Shipment has been cancelled.

TotalItemsQuantity.description: The total quantity of items included in the shipment. This value is calculated as the sum of the quantities of the shipment items in the shipment.

TrackingUrl.description: URL of website used for tracking the shipment.

Skill.name: Skill
Skill.description: Represents a category or group of Chat users or service resources in Field Service or Workforce Engagement.

Description.description: The description of the skill.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance slows down while Salesforce generates one for each record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed the skill.

TypeId.description: The skill type associated with the skill. This field is a relationship field. This field is available in API version 58.0 and later.

SkillRequirement.name: SkillRequirement
SkillRequirement.description: Represents a skill that is required to complete a particular task in Field Service, Omni-Channel, Salesforce Scheduler, or Workforce Engagement. Skill requirements can be added to pending service routing objects in Omni-Channel. They can be added to work types, work orders, and work order line items in Field Service and Lightning Scheduler. And they can be added to job profiles in Workforce Engagement.

IsAdditionalSkill.description: Indicates that a skill is additional. After a designated timeout period, a skill marked as additional is dropped from Omni-Channel routing. The case is then routed to the best-matched agent even if they don’t have all the skills.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

RelatedRecordId.description: The record that the skill is required for. The related record can be a work order, work order line item, work type, or pending service routing record.

SkillLevel.description: The level of the skill required. Skill levels can range from zero to 99.99. Depending on your business needs, you can have the skill level to reflect years of experience, certification levels, or license classes.

SkillNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the skill requirement.

SkillPriority.description: For additional skills, specify the order in which skills are dropped if after the specified timeout no agent with that skill is available. Higher priority-value skills are dropped first. Lower priority-value skills, for example 0, are dropped last. Skills with the same priority value are dropped as a group. You can set skill priority using skills-based routing rules or Apex code.

TimeSheet.name: TimeSheet
TimeSheet.description: Represents a schedule of a service resource’s time in Field Service or Workforce Engagement.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization. The label in the user interface is Currency ISO Code.

EndDate.description: The last day the time sheet covers.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last interacted with this record, directly or indirectly. Some sample scenarios are:

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it’s possible that the user only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate), but not viewed it.

OwnerId.description: The owner of the time sheet.

ServiceResourceId.description: The service resource whose time is being tracked with the time sheet.

StartDate.description: The first day the time sheet covers.

Status.description: The status of the time sheet. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: New Submitted Approved

TimeSheetEntryCount.description: (Read Only) The number of related time sheet entries.

TimeSheetNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the time sheet.

TotalDurationInHours.description: Represents the sum total of the duration field of all the time sheet entries related to the time sheet object in hours.

TotalDurationInMinutes.description: Represents the sum total of the duration field of all the time sheet entries related to the time sheet object in minutes.

TimeSheetEntry.name: TimeSheetEntry
TimeSheetEntry.description: Represents a span of time that a service resource spends on a field service task.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only if the multicurrency feature is enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization. The label in the user interface is Currency ISO Code.Time sheet entries inherit their time sheet’s currency code. Updates to a time sheet’s currency code aren’t reflected in existing time sheet entries’ currency code.

Description.description: Notes on how the time was spent. For example, “This service took longer than normal because the machine was jammed.”

DurationInMinutes.description: Minutes recorded on the time sheet entry.

EndTime.description: The date and time the activity finished.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last interacted with this record, directly or indirectly. Some sample scenarios are:

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it’s possible that the user only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate), but not viewed it.

LocationTimeZone.description: Time zone of the location where the activity occurred.

StartTime.description: The date and time the activity began.

Status.description: The status of the time sheet entry. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: New Submitted Approved

Subject.description: Activity performed; for example, repair, lunch, or travel.

TimeSheetEntryNumber.description: An auto-generated number identifying the time sheet entry.

TimeSheetId.description: The time sheet associated with the time sheet entry.

Type.description: The type of work performed. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: Direct Indirect

WorkOrderId.description: The work order related to the time sheet entry. Work orders are searchable by their content.

WorkOrderLineItemId.description: The work order line item related to the time sheet entry. Work order line items are searchable by their content.

TimeSlot.name: TimeSlot
TimeSlot.description: Represents a period of time on a specified day of the week during which work can be performed in Field Service, Salesforce Scheduler, or Workforce Engagement. Operating hours consist of one or more time slots.

DayOfWeek.description: The day of the week when the time slot takes place.

EndTime.description: The time when the time slot ends.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

MaxAppointments.description: Maximum number of appointments for a single time slot. Available in API version 47.0 and later.

OperatingHoursId.description: The operating hours that the time slot belongs to. An operating hours’ time slots appear in the Operating Hours related list.

StartTime.description: The time when the time slot starts.

RecordSetFilterCriteriaId.description: The ID of the recordset filter criteria selected for the time slot.

TimeSlotNumber.description: The name of the time slot. The name is auto-populated to a day and time format—for example, Monday 9:00 AM - 10:00 PM—but you can manually update it if you wish.

Type.description: The type of time slot. Possible values are Normal and Extended. You may choose to use Extended to represent overtime shifts.

WorkTypeGroupId.description: Work type group assigned to the time slot. Available in API version 47.0 and later.

TravelMode.name: TravelMode
TravelMode.description: Represents a travel mode used for travel time calculations. The records include information about the type of transportation (such as Car or Walking), whether a vehicle can take toll roads, and whether a vehicle is transporting hazardous materials.

CanUseTollRoads.description: Indicates if the vehicle is allowed to drive on toll roads.

IsLocked.description: Indicates whether the travel model record is locked or not.

IsTransportingHazmat.description: Indicates if the vehicle is transporting hazardous materials.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate=) but not viewed it.

MayEdit.description: Indicates whether the travel model record can be edited or not.

Name.description: Name of the travel mode.

OwnerId.description: ID of the owner of this object.

WarrantyTerm.name: WarrantyTerm
WarrantyTerm.description: Represents warranty terms defining the labor, parts, and expenses covered, along with any exchange options, provided to rectify issues with products.

Code.description: A code or other identifier associated with this warranty term.

Description.description: Description of the warranty term.

EffectiveStartDate.description: Date on which the warranty term became available for use.

ExpensesCoveredDuration.description: The duration for which expenses are covered.

ExpensesCoveredUnitOfTime.description: The unit in which expenses covered duration is measured.

IsActive.description: Defines whether the warranty term is active.

IsTransferable.description: Defines whether the warranty can be transferred to a new owner.

LaborCoveredDuration.description: The duration for which labor is covered.

LaborCoveredUnitOfTime.description: The unit in which labor covered duration is measured.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the warranty term was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the warranty term was last viewed.

OwnerId.description: The warranty term’s assigned owner.

PartsCoveredDuration.description: The duration for which parts are covered.

PartsCoveredUnitOfTime.description: The unit in which parts covered duration is measured.

Pricebook2Id.description: The ID of the price book item associated with this warranty term.

WarrantyDuration.description: The duration of the warranty offered by this term.

WarrantyTermName.description: The name of the warranty term.

WarrantyUnitOfTime.description: The unit in which the warranty duration is measured.

WorkCapacityAvailability.name: WorkCapacityAvailability
WorkCapacityAvailability.description: Represents the available work capacity for a specific time and service territory.

AvailCapacityHours.description: The number of available capacity in hours in the time frame the user defined for a service territory.

AvailCapacityMinutes.description: The number of available capacity in minutes in the time frame the user defined for a service territory.

EndDate.description: The end date of the total available capacity.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, and LastReferenceDate isn’t null, the user accessed this record or list view indirectly.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the owner of this object.

ServiceTerritoryId.description: The ID of the service territory of the work capacity availability calculation.

StartDate.description: The start date of the total available capacity.

TimePeriod.description: The time period the user selected when creating the work capacity limit. The value is copied from the TimePeriod field of the WorkCapacityLimit object.

WorkCapacityLimit.name: WorkCapacityLimit
WorkCapacityLimit.description: Represents the capacity limit in a specific service territory for a workstream or for the whole service territory in a given period.

CapacityLimitRelaxation.description: Defines the relaxation behavior that determines the limit override policy for this limit if the limit override policy is set per limit in Field Service Settings. If the limit override policy isn’t set per limit, this value is ignored. Valid strings are:

Description.description: Description of the work capacity limit.

EndDate.description: End date of the work capacity limit. If no EndDate is set this work capacity limit is without an expiration date.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the work capacity limit is active or inactive. When creating a record, save the record, and then activate it. You can't update fields in an active record.

IsFriday.description: Indicates whether the limitation is applied on Fridays.

IsMonday.description: Indicates whether the limitation is applied on Mondays.

IsSaturday.description: Indicates whether the limitation is applied on Saturdays.

IsSunday.description: Indicates whether the limitation is applied on Sundays.

IsSvcTerrOnlyLimit.description: Apply this work capacity limit to the entire service territory.

IsThursday.description: Indicates whether the limitation is applied on Thursdays.

IsTuesday.description: Indicates whether the limitation is applied on Tuesdays.

IsWednesday.description: Indicates whether the limitation is applied on Wednesdays.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, and LastReferenceDate isn’t null, the user accessed this record or list view indirectly.

LimitationValue.description: If the LimitationUnits is Hours, LimitationValue is the threshold that represents how many hours of total work capacity can be scheduled for a specific workstream in a service territory. Enter the number of hours for the daily limitation as a whole number.

OwnerId.description: ID of the creator of the work capacity limit.

ServiceTerritoryId.description: ID of the service territory of the work capacity workstream for which the limit is defined.

StartDate.description: The start date of the Work Capacity Limit.

SvcApptField.description: Work-specific criteria used to define the capacity limit for the workstream. The service appointment field is set for the organization when the first work capacity limit instance is created.

SvcApptFieldValDplyNm.description: The workstream display name of SvcApptFieldValue. If SvcApptField is a lookup to a service appointment, SvcApptFieldValue is an ID and the display name describes the value for the user.

SvcApptFieldValue.description: The value of SvcApptField, the work-specific criteria of the capacity limit.

TimePeriod.description: Duration for defining the capacity limitation on the workstream in the service territory.

WorkCapacityLimitNumber.description: Read-only. Auto populated, unique identifying number.

WorkCapacityUsage.name: WorkCapacityUsage
WorkCapacityUsage.description: Represents the capacity usage in a specific service territory for a workstream or for the whole service territory in a given period.

AvailCapacityHours.description: This value is copied from the AvailCapacityHours of the WorkCapacityAvailability object for the service territory on the same date.

CapacityLimitRelaxation.description: Defines the relaxation behavior that determines the limit override policy for this limit if the limit override policy is set per limit in Field Service Settings. If the limit override policy isn’t set per limit, this value is ignored. Valid strings are:

ConsumptionToLimitRatio.description: (Time consumed in hours / Limit in hours) * 100

EndDate.description: End date of the time period for which the capacity usage is accumulated.

IsSvcTerrOnlyLimit.description: Applies this work capacity limit to the entire service territory.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, and LastReferenceDate isn’t null, the user accessed this record or list view indirectly.

LimitationPercentage.description: If the LimitationUnits is Percentage this value is copied from the LimitationValue field of the WorkCapacityLimit object.

LimitationUnits.description: Defines whether the limitation for the workstream in the service territory is in hours or as a percentage of all the available hours for all the workstreams for which limitations exist in the service territory on a specific day.

LimitationValue.description: The LimitationValue depends on the LimitationUnit. If the LimitationUnit is Hours the value is copied from LimitationValue in the WorkCapacityLimit object. If the LimitationUnit is Percentage, the percentage is calculated relative to the availability in the WorkCapacityAvailability object.

OriginalLimit.description: If the limit value is changed after the work capacity usage was created, this parameter is the original value.

OwnerId.description: ID of the owner of this object.

ServiceTerritoryId.description: ID of the service territory of the work capacity workstream for which usage is accumulated.

StartDate.description: Start date of the time period for which the capacity usage is accumulated.

SvcApptField.description: Work-specific criteria used to define the capacity limit for the workstream.

SvcApptFieldValue.description: Value of SvcApptField, the work-specific criteria of the capacity limit.

TimeConsumedInHours.description: Time consumed in hours by the workstream in the service territory for the defined period. This value is calculated by dividing TimeConsumedInMinutes by 60.

TimeConsumedInMinutes.description: Time consumed in minutes by the workstream in the service territory for the defined period.

TimePeriod.description: Duration for defining the capacity limitation on the workstream in the service territory.

WcuUniqueField1.description: Read-only. Auto populated, unique identifying number.

WcuUniqueField2.description: Read-only. Auto populated, unique identifying number.

WorkCapacityUsageNumber.description: Read-only. Auto populated, unique identifying number.

WorkOrder.name: WorkOrder
WorkOrder.description: Represents field service work to be performed for a customer.

AccountId.description: The account associated with the work order.

Address.description: The compound form of the address where the work order is completed.

AssetId.description: The asset associated with the work order.

AssetWarrantyId.description: The asset warranty term associated with the work order. This field is available in API version 50.0 and above.

BusinessHoursId.description: The business hours associated with the work order.

CaseId.description: The case associated with the work order.

City.description: The city where the work order is completed. Maximum length is 40 characters.

ContactId.description: The contact associated with the work order.

Country.description: The country where the work order is completed. Maximum length is 80 characters.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization. The label in the user interface is Currency ISO Code.

Description.description: The description of the work order. Try to include the steps needed to change the work order’s status to Completed.

Discount.description: Read only. The weighted average of the discounts on all line items in the work order. It can be any positive number up to 100.

Duration.description: The estimated time required to complete the work order. Specify the duration unit in the Duration Type field. If the Duration field on a Work Order is null, it adopts the duration value from the Work Type object when the work type is updated or inserted. Note Work order duration and work order line item duration are independent of each other. If you want work order duration to automatically show the sum of the work order line items’ duration, replace the Duration field on work orders with a custom roll-up summary field.

DurationInMinutes.description: The estimated duration in minutes. For internal use only.

DurationType.description: The unit of the duration: Minutes or Hours.

EndDate.description: The date when the work order is completed. This field is blank unless you set up an Apex trigger or quick action to populate it. For example, you can create a quick action that sets the EndDate to 365 days after the StartDate.

EntitlementId.description: The entitlement associated with the work order.

GeocodeAccuracy.description: Accuracy level of the geocode for the address. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields. Note conref="sforce_api_objects_workorderlineitem.xml#sforce_api_objects_workorderlineitem/api_only"

GrandTotal.description: Read only. The total price of the work order with tax added.

IsClosed.description: Indicates whether the work order is closed (true) or open (false). Tip Use this field to report on closed versus open work orders.

IsGeneratedFromMaintenancePlan.description: (Read Only) Indicates that the work order was generated from a maintenance plan (true), rather than manually created (false). Note This option is deselected for work orders that were generated from maintenance plans before Summer ’18.

IsStopped.description: Indicates whether a milestone is paused (true) or counting down (false). This field is available only if Enable stopped time and actual elapsed time is selected on the Entitlement Settings page.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the work order was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the work order was last viewed.

Latitude.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the work order is completed. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields. Note This field is available in the API only.

LineItemCount.description: The number of work order line items in the work order. Its label in the user interface is Line Items.

LocationId.description: The location associated with the work order. For example, a work site.

Longitude.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the work order is completed. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places. See Compound Field Considerations and Limitations for details on geolocation compound fields. Note This field is available in the API only.

MaintenancePlanId.description: The maintenance plan associated with the work order. When the work order is auto-generated from a maintenance plan, this field automatically lists the related plan.

MaintenanceWorkRuleId.description: ID of the maintenance work rule that generated this work order. This field is available in API version 50.0 and above.

MilestoneStatus.description: Indicates the status of a milestone. This field is visible if an entitlement process is applied to a work order.

MinimumCrewSize.description: The minimum crew size allowed for a crew assigned to the work order. If you’re not using the Field Service managed package, this field serves as a suggestion rather than a rule. If you are using the managed package, the scheduling optimizer counts the number of service crew members on a service crew to determine whether it fits a work order’s minimum crew size requirement.

OwnerId.description: The work order’s assigned owner.

ParentWorkOrderId.description: The work order’s parent work order, if it has one. Tip Create a custom report to view a work order’s child work orders.

PostWorkSummary.description: The summary of a completed work order that’s either entered manually or created by an AI agent.

PostalCode.description: The postal code where the work order is completed. Maximum length is 20 characters.

PreWorkBriefPromptTemplate.description: The ID of the activated Pre-Work Brief prompt template.

Pricebook2Id.description: The price book associated with the work order. Adding a price book to the work order lets you assign different price book entries to the work order’s line items. This is only available if Product2 is enabled.

Priority.description: The priority of the work order. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: Low Medium High Critical

ProductServiceCampaignId.description: The product service campaign associated with the work order.

ProductServiceCampaignItemId.description: The product service campaign item associated with the work order.

RecommendedCrewSize.description: The recommended number of people on the service crew assigned to the work order. For example, you might have a Minimum Crew Size of 2 and a Recommended Crew Size of 3.

ReturnOrderId.description: The return order associated with the work order.

ReturnOrderLineItemId.description: The return order line item associated with the work order.

RootWorkOrderId.description: (Read only) The top-level work order in a work order hierarchy. Depending on where a work order lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent. Note View a work order’s child work order in the Child Work Orders related list.

ServiceAppointmentCount.description: The number of service appointments on the work order.

ServiceContractId.description: The service contract associated with the work order.

ServiceDocumentTemplate.description: The template ID which sets the template for each service document for the Document Builder feature.

ServiceReportLanguage.description: The language used for all service reports and service report previews created for the work order, its service appointments, and its work order line items and their service appointments. If the field is blank, service reports are generated in the default language in Salesforce of the person creating the report.To appear as an option in the ServiceReportLanguage field, a language must be set up in Translation Workbench or be one of Salesforce’s 18 fully supported languages. Rich text fields and service report section names aren’t translated.

ServiceReportTemplateId.description: The service report template that the work order uses. If you don’t specify a service report template on a work order, it uses the service report template listed on its work type. If the work type doesn’t list a template or no work type is specified, the work order uses the default service report template.

ServiceTerritoryId.description: The service territory where the work order is taking place.

SlaExitDate.description: The time that the work order exits the entitlement process.

SlaStartDate.description: The time that the work order enters the entitlement process. You can update or reset the time if you have “Edit” permission on work orders.

StartDate.description: The date when the work order goes into effect. This field is blank unless you set up an Apex trigger or quick action to populate it. For example, you can create a quick action that sets the StartDate to the date when the Status changes to In Progress.

State.description: The state where the work order is completed. Maximum length is 80 characters.

Status.description: The status of the work order. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: New—Work order was created, but there hasn’t yet been any activity. In Progress—Work has begun. On Hold—Work is paused. Completed—Work is complete. Cannot Complete—Work could not be completed. Closed—All work and associated activity is complete. Canceled—Work is canceled, typically before any work began. Changing a work order’s status does not affect the status of its work order line items or associated service appointments.

StatusCategory.description: The category that each Status value falls into. The Status Category field has eight default values: seven values which are identical to the default Status values, and a None value for statuses without a status category.If you create custom Status values, you must indicate which category it belongs to. For example, if you create a Waiting for Response value, you may decide that it belongs in the On Hold category. To learn which processes reference StatusCategory, see How are Status Categories Used?

StopStartDate.description: Indicates when the milestone was paused. The label in the user interface is Stopped Since.

Street.description: The street number and name where the work order is completed.

Subject.description: The subject of the work order. Try to describe the nature and purpose of the job to be completed. For example, “Annual On-Site Well Maintenance.” Maximum length is 255 characters.

Subtotal.description: Read only. The total of the work order line items’ subtotals before discounts and taxes are applied.

SuggestedMaintenanceDate.description: The suggested date that the work order is completed. When the work order is auto-generated from a maintenance plan, this field is automatically populated based on the maintenance plan’s settings.

Tax.description: The total tax on the work order. You can enter a number with or without the currency symbol and use up to two decimal places. For example, in a work order whose total price is $100, enter $10 to apply a 10% tax.

TotalPrice.description: Read only. The total of the work order line items’ prices. This value has discounts applied but not tax.

WorkOrderNumber.description: An eight-digit, auto-generated number that identifies the work order.

WorkTypeId.description: The work type associated with the work order. When a work type is selected, the work order automatically inherits the work type’s Duration, Duration Type, and required skills. If the Duration field for the work type is null, enter the duration value.

WorkOrderLineItem.name: WorkOrderLineItem
WorkOrderLineItem.description: Represents a subtask on a work order in field service.

Address.description: The compound form of the address where the line item is completed.

AssetId.description: The asset associated with the work order line item. The asset is not automatically inherited from the parent work order.

AssetWarrantyId.description: The asset warranty term associated with the work order line item. This field is available in API version 50.0 and above.

City.description: The city where the line item is completed. Maximum length is 40 characters.

Country.description: The country where the line item is completed. Maximum length is 80 characters.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Available only for orgs with the multicurrency feature enabled. Contains the ISO code for any currency allowed by the organization. The label in the user interface is Currency ISO Code.

Description.description: The description of the work order line item. Try to describe the steps needed to mark the line item Completed.

Discount.description: The percent discount to apply to the line item. You can enter a number with or without the percent symbol, and you can use up to two decimal places.

Duration.description: The estimated time required to complete the line item. Specify the duration unit in the Duration Type field. If the Duration field on a Work Order is null, it adopts the duration value from the Work Type object when the work type is updated or inserted. Note Work order duration and work order line item duration are independent of each other. If you want work order duration to automatically show the sum of the work order line items’ duration, replace the Duration field on work orders with a custom roll-up summary field.

DurationInMinutes.description: The estimated duration in minutes. For internal use only.

DurationType.description: The unit of the duration: Minutes or Hours.

EndDate.description: The date on which the line item is completed. This field is blank unless you set up an Apex trigger or quick action to populate it. For example, you can create a quick action that sets the EndDate to 365 days after the StartDate.

GeocodeAccuracy.description: The level of accuracy of a location’s geographical coordinates compared with its physical address. Usually provided by a geocoding service based on the address’s latitude and longitude coordinates. Note This field is available in the API only.

IsClosed.description: Indicates whether the line item has been closed. Changing the line item’s status to Closed causes this checkbox to be selected in the user interface (sets IsClosed to true). Tip Use this field to report on closed versus open work order line items.

IsGeneratedFromMaintenancePlan.description: Identifies whether the work order line item is generated from a maintenance plan.

LastReferencedDate.description: The date when the line item was last modified. Its label in the user interface is Last Modified Date.

LastViewedDate.description: The date when the line item was last viewed.

Latitude.description: Used with Longitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the line item is completed. Acceptable values are numbers between –90 and 90 with up to 15 decimal places. Note This field is available in the API only.

LineItemNumber.description: An auto-generated number that identifies the work order line item. Each work order’s line items start at 1.

ListPrice.description: The price of the line item (product) as listed in its corresponding price book entry. If a price book entry isn’t specified, the list price defaults to zero.

LocationId.description: A location associated with the work order line item. For example, a work site.

Longitude.description: Used with Latitude to specify the precise geolocation of the address where the line item is completed. Acceptable values are numbers between –180 and 180 with up to 15 decimal places. Note This field is available in the API only.

MaintenancePlanId.description: The maintenance plan associated with the work order line item.

MaintenanceWorkRuleId.description: ID of the maintenance work rule that generated this line item. This field is available in API version 50.0 and above.

MinimumCrewSize.description: The minimum crew size allowed for a crew assigned to the line item. If you’re not using the Field Service managed package, this field serves as a suggestion rather than a rule. If you are using the managed package, the scheduling optimizer counts the number of service crew members on a service crew to determine whether it fits a work order line item’s minimum crew size requirement.

OrderId.description: The order associated with the line item. For example, you may need to order replacement parts before you can complete the line item.

ParentWorkOrderLineItemId.description: The line item’s parent work order line item, if it has one. Tip Create a custom report to view a line item’s child line items.

PostalCode.description: The postal code where the line item is completed. Maximum length is 20 characters.

PricebookEntryId.description: The price book entry (product) associated with the line item. The label in the user interface is Product. This field’s lookup search only returns products that are included in the work order’s price book.

Priority.description: The priority of the line item. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: Low Medium High Critical

Product2Id.description: (Read only) The product associated with the price book entry. This field is not available in the user interface. For best results, use the PricebookEntryId field in any custom code or layouts.

ProductServiceCampaignId.description: The product service campaign associated with the work order line item.

ProductServiceCampaignItemId.description: The product service campaign item associated with the work order line item.

Quantity.description: Number of units of the line item included in the associated work order.

RecommendedCrewSize.description: The recommended number of people on the service crew assigned to the line item. For example, you might have a Minimum Crew Size of 2 and a Recommended Crew Size of 3.

ReturnOrderId.description: The return order associated with the work order line item.

ReturnOrderLineItemId.description: The return order line item associated with the work order line item.

RootWorkOrderLineItemId.description: (Read only) The top-level line item in a work order line item hierarchy. Depending on where a line item lies in the hierarchy, its root could be the same as its parent. Note View a line item’s child line items in the Child Work Order Line Items related list.

ServiceAppointmentCount.description: The number of service appointments on the work order line item.

ServiceDocumentTemplate.description: The template ID which sets the template for each service document for the Document Builder feature.

ServiceReportTemplateId.description: The service report template that the line item uses. If you don’t specify a service report template on a work order line item, it uses the service report template listed on its work type. If the work type doesn’t list a template or no work type is specified, the line item uses the default service report template.

ServiceTerritoryId.description: The service territory where the line item is completed.

StartDate.description: The date on which the line item goes into effect. This field is blank unless you set up an Apex trigger or quick action to populate it. For example, you can create a quick action that sets the StartDate to the date when the Status changes to In Progress.

State.description: The state where the line item is completed. Maximum length is 80 characters.

Status.description: The status of the line item. The picklist includes the following values, which can be customized: New—Line item was created, but there hasn’t yet been any activity. In Progress—Work has begun. On Hold—Work is paused. Completed—Work is complete. Cannot Complete—Work could not be completed. Closed—All work and associated activity is complete. Canceled—Work is canceled, typically before any work began.

StatusCategory.description: The category that each Status value falls into. The Status Category field has eight default values: seven values which are identical to the default Status values, and a None value for statuses without a status category.If you create custom Status values, you must indicate which category it belongs to. For example, if you create a Waiting for Response value, you may decide that it belongs in the On Hold category. To learn which processes reference StatusCategory, see How are Status Categories Used?

Street.description: The street number and name where the line item is completed.

Subject.description: A word or phrase describing the line item.

Subtotal.description: (Read only) The line item’s unit price multiplied by the quantity.

SuggestedMaintenanceDate.description: Date when maintenance work is planned.

TotalPrice.description: Read only. The line item’s subtotal with discounts applied.

UnitPrice.description: Initially, the unit price for a work order line item is the line item’s list price from the price book, but you can change it.

WorkOrderId.description: The line item’s parent work order. Because work order line items must be associated with a work order, this is a required field.

WorkTypeId.description: The work type associated with the line item. When a work type is selected, the line item automatically inherits the work type’s Duration, Duration Type, and required skills. If the Duration field for the work type is null, enter the duration value.

WorkOrderLineItemStatus.name: WorkOrderLineItemStatus
WorkOrderLineItemStatus.description: Represents a possible status of a work order line item in field service.

ApiName.description: The API name of the status value.

IsDefault.description: Indicates that the status value is the default status on work orders. Only one status value can be the default.

MasterLabel.description: The label for the picklist value that appears in the UI.

SortOrder.description: The value’s position in the drop-down list of values in the UI.

StatusCode.description: The status category that the value corresponds to. The Status Category field has seven values which are identical to the default Status values.

WorkOrderStatus.name: WorkOrderStatus
WorkOrderStatus.description: Represents a possible status of a work order in field service.

ApiName.description: The API name of the status value.

IsDefault.description: Indicates that the status value is the default status on work orders. Only one status value can be the default.

MasterLabel.description: The label for the picklist value that appears in the UI.

SortOrder.description: The value’s position in the drop-down list of values in the UI.

StatusCode.description: The status category that the value corresponds to. The Status Category field has seven values which are identical to the default Status values.

WorkPlan.name: WorkPlan
WorkPlan.description: Represents a work plan for a work order or work order line item.

Description.description: The description of the work plan.

ExecutionOrder.description: The order in which the work plan is executed. Only positive values or null are supported.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last interacted with this record, directly or indirectly. Some sample scenarios are:

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it’s possible that the user only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate), but not viewed it.

Name.description: The name of the work plan.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who created the work plan.

ParentRecordId.description: The ID of the work order, work order line item, or change request that the work plan is associated with. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

ParentRecordType.description: Describes whether the parent record is a work order, work order line item, or change request. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

WorkOrderId.description: Required. The ID of the work order.

WorkOrderLineItemId.description: The ID of the work order line item.

WorkPlanTemplateId.description: The ID of the work plan template record. Available in API version 54.0 and later.

WorkPlanSelectionRule.name: WorkPlanSelectionRule
WorkPlanSelectionRule.description: Represents a rule that selects a work plan for a work order or work order line item.

Description.description: The description of the selection rule.

IsActive.description: Controls whether this selection rule is active (true) or not (false). Default is false. Label is Active.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last interacted with this record, directly or indirectly. Some sample scenarios are:

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it’s possible that the user only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate), but not viewed it.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the owner.

Product2Id.description: The ID of the product. Label is Product.

ServiceTerritoryId.description: The ID of the service territory.

WorkPlanSelectionRuleNumber.description: The auto-generated number of the work plan selection rule, for example, WPSR-0001.

WorkPlanTemplateId.description: Required. The ID of the work plan template.

WorkTypeId.description: The ID of the work type.

WorkPlanTemplate.name: WorkPlanTemplate
WorkPlanTemplate.description: Represents a template for a work plan.

Description.description: The description of the work plan template.

IsActive.description: Controls whether the specific template is available for application (true) or not (false). Default is false. Label is Active.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last interacted with this record, directly or indirectly. Some sample scenarios are:

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it’s possible that the user only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate), but not viewed it.

Name.description: The user-defined name of the work plan template.
